If we do not step in to protect them, it will be seen as a declaration of support for the Boxers and an act of war against the great powers. If we do, the Boxers will see it as a betrayal of their cause and perhaps even rise up in rebellion against us. They have forced our hand now, however, and we have no choice but to act.
Boxers Attack $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Legation

\n\nThe Boxer situation in $FROMCOUNTRY$ has reached a head: the Chinese nationalists have entered Peking, laying siege to the Legation Quarter and putting the lives of dozes of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants and dignitaries at risk. The Qing government has looked the other way, an act that is seen by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government as a declaration of war. Many are calling upon us to intervene in order to protect $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens from these barbarians.
The Boxer Protocol

\n\nWe are forced to submit to the foreign demands, signing a treaty with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ generals and representatives from all the great powers. The Righteous Harmony Society will be forcibly disbanded, its leaders executed or imprisoned, and our government is once again humiliated.

\n\n$FROMCOUNTRY$ has submitted to the intervening powers, signing a treaty that promises to forcibly dismantle the Boxers and pay reparations for the atrocities committed in their name -- and explicitly supported by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government.
We shall remain silent... for now.
Should we be alarmed?
Look the other way.
Suppress them. The westerners must not be harmed.
This cannot be tolerated.
Declare support for the Boxers.
Protect the foreign legations.
This calls for intervention.
We will do nothing.
We have little option.
Agree to the protocol.
We will continue our war §RGain 5 infamy§W
The Beiyang Army will keep order in China.
The Kuomintang will lead the republic.
Try to work with these societies.
Crush them. This will not be tolerated.
Root them out. This cannot be permitted.
Make minor reforms to appease the revolutionaries.
The Mandate of Heaven

The Mandate of Heaven was a Chinese political and religious doctrine used to justify the rule of the emperor of China. According to this belief, heaven (tian) - which embodies the natural order and will of the universe - bestows the mandate on a just ruler, the Son of Heaven.

If a ruler was overthrown, this was interpreted as an indication that the ruler was unworthy, and had lost the mandate. It was also a common belief that natural disasters such as famine and flood were signs of heaven's displeasure with the ruler, so there would often be revolts following major disasters as citizens saw these as signs that the Mandate of Heaven had been withdrawn.
Of course.
Loss of the Mandate of Heaven
\n\nWith the humiliation of defeat against foreign invaders, horrific natural disasters, and numerous rebellions across the land, it seems the Manchu emperors have lost the divine right to rule...
Oh no!
The barbarians will learn to bow.
Avoid angering the barbarians.
Is this emperor a madman?
We cannot afford a war at the moment.
They shall receive a chilly reception in our court.
This is not the time to provoke them.
But we haven't cleared up after last time yet.
Not again!
The Opium Trade in China

Opium use in China first began with the use of opium for medicinal purposes during the 7th century, the practice of mixing opium with tobacco for smoking spread from Southeast Asia in the 17th century, creating a far greater demand. Imports of opium into China stood at 200 chests annually in 1729, when the first anti-opium edict was promulgated. By the time $COUNTRY_ADJ$ authorities reissued the prohibition in starker terms in 1799, the figure had leaped: 4,500 chests were imported in 1800. The decade of the 1830s witnessed a rapid rise in opium trade, and by $YEAR$, it had climbed to 40,000 chests. 

The imperial decree had little effect, the Qing government, far away in Peking in the north, would prove unable to halt opium smuggling in the south. A porous border and rampant demand facilitated the trade, resulting in widespread use throughout much of the south.
This cannot be allowed.
Demand they be handed over!
We cannot fight the British.
This may be just the excuse we need. §RGain 3 infamy§W
Leave the Chinese alone. §R(Pay or owe 50,000¤)§W
Give them what they want.
Never! We shall not submit!
An unfortunate choice.
Make the deal with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$.
No. We will keep what we have now.
Forget it. We will keep what we have.
Every dog has its day.
We have other things to do. §R(Pay or owe 50,000¤)§W
We agree to their terms.
We refuse.
Maine Incident
We are pleased.
Unfortunate.
They will serve $COUNTRY$. Or else.
This is becoming worrisome.
$COUNTRY$ shall be restored!
We will side with the Kuomintang.
We will side with the Beiyang.
We will remain neutral.
We will fight for Communist China.
The Beiyang must fight for the greater glory of China.
He shall pay for this betrayal!
Join the forces of Nationalist China.
Abandon the Kuomintang.
Together we shall triumph!
For the good of all China.
Now is not the time.
$COUNTRY$ shall submit.
We accept Beijing's rule but will maintain our independence.
$COUNTRY$ shall never surrender!
Good luck with that.
It seems we have little choice.
Victory is ours!
$COUNTRY$ Is Lost
\n\n$COUNTRY$ has been overrun. We must face the fact that we have lost the civil war and surrender.
A dark day.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Surrenders
\n\nThe $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers have laid down their arms.
Excellent.
The Civil War Drags On
\n\nWe have been engaged in a civil war that seems to go nowhere. Our people demand a rest.
Truce With $FROMCOUNTRY$?
\n\nThe war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ appears to be going nowhere. Should we lay down our arms?
Indeed.
The Kowloon Incident

A drunken riot by a large group of British sailors ashore at Kowloon has resulted in the death of a local named Lin Weixi in the village of Tsim Sha Tsui. Unlike English common law, Chinese law held the community, rather than the individual, responsible for transgressions. 

Imperial Commissioner Lin Zexu demanded the death of the culprit and was prepared to accept any sailor, whether innocent or guilty, to settle the matter. The British, however, have demanded extraterritoriality -- meaning their citizens would be tried by British judges. This will inevitably lead to their release and the anger of our citizens, but demanding these men executions could lead to war.
The Unequal Treaty

The war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ is not going well. These damnable foreigners are in our lands and blockading our ports, and to the embarrassment of our government there seems to be little we can do to stop them. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have approached us to negotiate a 'fair' settlement. While we could drag the war on and see if the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have the wherewithal to finish their assault, it might be in our best interest to give them a concession port and reparations. Indeed, this might even help us in some ways, though the loss to our prestige would be considerable.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Agrees

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership has signed our peace treaty, granting us a concession port on their coast as well as reparations. This has improved relations between our countries tremendously, and should go a long way to ensuring $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in China remains strong.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has Refused!
\n\nThe $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have refused to submit. The war must go on.
The Treaty of Shimonoseki

\n\nThe war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ is not going well. The damnable Japanese are in our lands and blockading our ports, and to the embarrassment of our government there seems to be little we can do to stop them. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have approached us to negotiate a 'fair' settlement -- hand over Formosa and pay reparations. While we could drag the war on and see if the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have the wherewithal to finish their assault, it might be in our best interest to give them what they want, though the loss to our prestige would be considerable.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Agrees

\n\nThe $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership has signed our peace treaty, granting us Formosa as well as reparations. This has improved relations between our countries tremendously, and should go a long way to ensuring $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in Asia remains strong.

\n\nWe have lost all patience with the barbarians who call themselves our 'masters'. They ignore our laws, our customs, and force themselves upon the generosity of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ throne at every opportunity. It is time we turned them out, refused them their free reign in our lands and ports and demonstrated the true might of our Emperor.
$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Envoy Ejected

\n\nRelations have been cool with $FROMCOUNTRY$, laced with bitterness over our nation's superiority. Lately the situation has reached a boiling point, and we have received a report that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ envoy to the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ court has been ejected. Indeed, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ nationals throughout $FROMCOUNTRY$ are reporting harassment and outright violence. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ are being refused berth at Chinese harbors. This is a systematic campaign by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ emperor to reduce our influence.
Empire of the Great Qing

\n\nChina has no need for, nor interest in, foreigners and their gifts no matter how ingenious they may be. It is only due to the emperor's generosity that foreigners are allowed to trade at all, and all such trade must take place at our will. The yi barbarians should tremble as they obey us and show no negligence! Barbarians shall bow down before the Chinese emperor in the manner customary for tributary envoys.
The Arrow Incident

\n\n$COUNTRY_ADJ$ officials recently boarded the Arrow, a Chinese-owned ship (a lorcha) that was suspected of piracy and smuggling. Twelve Chinese crew members were arrested on suspicion of piracy by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ authorities. British officials have demanded the release of the sailors, however, claiming that because the ship had recently been British-registered, it was under their protection. They also demand reparations. The Imperial court has been enraged by this claim, suggesting that agreeing to British demands would give smugglers free reign throughout China.
Punish the pirates!
Relent to the British demands.

\n\n$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ officials recently boarded the Arrow, a ship that -- according to all reports -- was flying British colors at the time. The Chinese claim this isn't the case, and we've received news that they intend to crack down on the opium trade throughout the Empire. The British government is up in arms, saying that we must exert our influence over the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ if we are to retain our position in the Far East.
The Kowloon Incident

\n\nAn incident that began with drunken sailors murdering a Chinese man has escalated into a larger crisis with the Qing government. We have insisted that these sailors be tried by a British judge -- the barbaric Chinese judicial system would result in these men getting anything but a fair trial. The Chinese have demanded the men be turned over, and what's more that they be given the right to punish British citizens as needed. The confrontation has resulted in larger trade sanctions being applied against British merchants, and threats of worse. Our prestige as an Empire to be reckoned with is being threatened.
The Unequal Treaty
\n\nIn a display of diplomatic force, $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have forced $COUNTRY$ to sign a treaty with them, forcing numerous trade as well as territory concessions.
The Simla Convention

\n\nBritish diplomats have approached the Tibet government, hoping to broker a peaceful arrangement between Tibet and China now that Tibet is independent. No doubt they intend to gain influence and territory in our nation, as well as an ally against Chinese aggression, but the prospect of war should the negotiations fail seems likely.

\n\nBritish diplomats have approached the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, hoping to broker a peaceful arrangement between Tibet and $COUNTRY$ now that Tibet is independent. No doubt they intend to gain influence and territory in Tibet, as well as an ally against $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aggression,, but the prospect of war should the negotiations fail seems likely.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Has Agreed
\n\n$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have agreed to the arrangements made at the Simla Convention, and our relations with them have improved as a result -- not to mention our prestige.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Has Refused
\n\n$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have refused the arrangements made at the Simla Convention, and our relations with them have cooled as a result.
The New Army

\n\nOur efforts to modernize the Beiyang army have borne fruit, but this has necessitated the division of authority among regional forces. The generals in charge of these forces, 'warlords' as some call them, have been gaining a great deal of power. They are part of the Beiyang Army, but fight amongst themselves... And, far worse, are critical of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government. We will need to watch these generals carefully.
Spread of Anhui Influence

\n\nWarlord influence has begun to spread into $STATENAME$. These generals are still loyal to $COUNTRY$, but it is becoming increasingly apparent that they are taking control of a significant portion of the country. Officials in $CAPITAL$ are alarmed.
Spread of Guangdong Influence
Spread of Guangxi Influence
Spread of Hunan Influence
Spread of Fengtien Influence
Spread of Ma Influence
Spread of Yunnan Influence
Spread of Shanxi Influence
Spread of Sichuan Influence
Spread of Xinjiang Influence
The Warlord Era

\n\nResistance against the $CAPITAL$ government has culminated in a breakdown in authority. What began with several of the outlying warlords declaring their independence has ended with the most powerful generals in the Beiyang Army struggling for control. A contest has begun regarding who will control the future of China's destiny, and most are certain it will not be long before the entire nation is engulfed in war.
The Struggle for China

\n\nNow that we are free, we must choose where we stand in the ensuing struggle for the nation's destiny: either side with the Kuomintang and fight for domination of the republic or side with the Beiyang and fight for domination of a united China. Alternatively, we can declare our neutrality in the conflict and let the chips fall where they may.
The Guominjun Clique

\n\nA $COUNTRY_ADJ$ general by the name of Feng Yuxiang has betrayed his superiors and broken off from the Beiyang armies. He and his supporters have taken the territory under their control and formed a new clique, swearing to topple the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government.
Leader of the Kuomintang

\n\nThe leaders of the Kuomintang are preparing for their drive on Beijing, and $COUNTRY$ is expected to answer the call. Either we side with Nationalist China now, or we must abandon the Kuomintang cause and seek our own destiny.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Joins the Kuomintang
\n\n$FROMCOUNTRY$ has answered the call, and will unite their forces with ours.
The War of Reunification

\n\nThe $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people are crying out for the nation to once again unify. We must gather our strength and strike out at those who would divide China, leaving it weak for foreigners to prey upon. Already the banners are in the streets, and $COUNTRY$'s generals are saying now is the time to launch an offensive.
War with $FROMCOUNTRY$!

\n\nWe have received reports that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ army is massing on our mutual border, ready to make a massive offensive into $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territory. It seems a war is upon us, whether we like it or not: either they destroy us or we destroy them.
Chinese Reunification

\n\nThe call has come from the capital: the era of warlords is over, and all the Chinese peoples must unite under a single flag. This means $COUNTRY$ must either submit to Beijing's rule or face more war against a strong and unified foe. Your generals stand ready to receive your command.
The Island of Formosa
\n\nNow that we own the island of Formosa, the local Min population has begun to organize itself -- presumably towards the end of breaking away from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ control.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Victory

\n\n$FROMCOUNTRY$ has won its war against us. Now their generals walk into $CAPITAL$, gloating with their superiority. It seems that, should they force us to the negotiating table to demand yet more concessions, we will have little choice but to comply.
The Treaty of Shimonoseki

\n\nWe have won a great victory against $FROMCOUNTRY$. Now we must consider -- do we negotiate with them, perhaps promising the return of some of their land in exchange for the island of Formosa and reparations? Or do we stay our current course and perhaps alarm the Western nations at our advances into $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ territory?
The Unequal Treaty

\n\nWe have won a great war against $FROMCOUNTRY$. Now we are faced with a dilemma: do we force the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government to the negotiating table, perhaps promising the return of some of their land in exchange for a treaty port and reparations? Or do we stay our current course and perhaps alarm the other great powers at our advances into $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ territory?
The Unequal Treaty

\n\nAs we thought, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ infidels have forced a so-called 'treaty' upon us, demanding a great deal of reparations and land concession -- in return for land they currently possess but have no more right to.
The Destruction of the Eiffel Tower

Heavy street fighting erupts in the small streets of Paris as $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ forces advance into in a bid to capture the city. Artillery is moved to the Chaillot Hill, past improvised barriers while infantry run away from the 7th arrondissement and move systematically from house to house, block by block, fighting a running battle against armed irregulars. The Arc de Triomphe is demolished by $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ pioneers while the artillery in Chaillot hill set their sights on the Eiffel Tower. For several minutes the city is taken by the roar of artillery until silence falls and the only sound is the screeching of retorted metal slowly bending. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers shout excitedly as they watch the Eiffel Tower bend and fall into the Seine, now reduced to an amorphous lump of metal. 
 
 Fires rage out of control in the eastern parts of the city, lighting up the skyline as the fighting continues into the night.
A dark day for $COUNTRY$.
The Fall of the Palace of Westminster

\n\nScattered gunfire can be heard echoing through the empty streets of London as the last pockets of resistance to the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ occupation are quelled. The parliament houses in the Palace of Westminster lay empty while $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers run up and down placing explosives in the silent corridors. A $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ general silently read the orders that came from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ capital with instructions to destroy the Palace in an attempt to crush the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ spirit. The explosives are detonated at the same time as the Clock Tower bell strike its precise hourly strike. The tower is engulfed by flames as parts of the western palace collapse, with pieces of the Big Ben landing on the Thames along with other debris while nearby buildings are hit by flaming debris and catch fire. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers watch and cherish from a safe distance as the glass that once contained the phrase "DOMINE SALVAM FAC REGINAM NOSTRAM VICTORIAM PRIMAM" rains on the ground. Nearby, $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers storm the Buckingham Palace just to find out that the $MONARCHTITLE$ has already fled the country. They hoist the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ flag and turn to see the smoke rising in the horizon. London is lost.
Declare war now! §RGain 1 infamy§W
Socialists

\n\nKarl Marx has published The Communist Manifesto, which has led to workers in $COUNTRY$ to found a party dedicated to advancing the agenda laid out therein. They call themselves socialists and believe in a land ruled by the workers, where the workers control the means of production. Equality, justice, solidarity and democracy are other vital points in the socialists ideology.
Workers of the world, Unite!
The First International

'Comrades, it is a great fact that the misery of the working masses has not diminished from 1836 to $YEAR$ in $COUNTRY$, and yet this period is unrivaled in the development of its industry and the growth of its commerce. Capital is dead labor, that, vampire-like, only lives by sucking living labor, and lives the more, the more labor it sucks. The time during which the laborer works, is the time during which the capitalist consumes the labor-power he has purchased of him. As time passes, all social rules and all relations between individuals are eroded by a cash economy, avarice drags Pluto himself out of the bowels of the earth. In light of this, we want, no, we NEED a free society, where no one is considered to be superior, no one is left behind and where mankind is free from oppression and scarcity. We need a society without a government, without class divisions and where the workers control the means of production. 
 The proletarians have nothing to lose but their chains.'
Let the ruling classes tremble at the Communist revolution.
Radicals

'Instead of the state controlling the law enforcement, the courts and the national defense, the different law systems should be provided by voluntarily-founded private competitors. Money should be privately and competitively provided in an open market and personal and economic activities should be regulated by the natural laws of the market and through private law rather than through politics.'\n\n A group of liberals disgruntled with their lack of economic freedom, and the pace of parliamentary reform, have formed a new faction in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ politics. The Radicals are the revolutionary avantgarde of the liberal ideology, and they will not hesitate to use whatever means necessary to see their ideas of freedom and free trade instituted both in $COUNTRY$ and abroad.
Okay.
The Rise of Mysticism

\n\nImperial Russia is confronted with a religious renaissance, a widespread interest in spiritual-ethical literature and non-conformist moral-spiritual movements, an upsurge in pilgrimage and other devotions to sacred spaces and objects. The "God-Seeking" are shaping their own ritual and spiritual lives, sometimes in the absence of clergy. The upper class of $CAPITAL$ has been widely influenced by this wave of mysticism. Individual aristocrats are reportedly obsessed with anything occult and this new fever for anything mystic has been spreading to the middle class and the peasants.
Imaginary things can't hurt the nation.
Mysticism? In *my* Imperial Russia?
The Tzar's Son Falls Ill

\n\nIn $YEAR$, Tsesarevich Alexei, the Tzar's son, received an injury which caused him painful bleeding. When the doctors could not supply a cure, the desperate Tzarina looked for other help. Grigori Rasputin, a peasant who identified as a strannik, a religious wanderer, had already treated other nobles families and came for the desperate Tzarina. Rasputin was said to possess the ability to heal through prayer and was able to calm the parents and to give the boy some relief, in spite of the doctors' prediction that he would die. On the following day the boy showed significant signs of recovery. The careless Alexei received the last sacrament during another particularly grave crisis, and the desperate Tzarina turned to her lady-in-waiting, to secure the help of the peasant healer. The next day, Rasputin responded and sent a short telegram, including the prophecy: "The little one will not die. Do not allow the doctors to bother him too much." The boy's temperature dropped and the hematoma disappeared.
Well, I will be damned.
Intrigue in the Russian Court

\n\nWhile fascinated by Rasputin in the beginning, the ruling class of $CAPITAL$ became envious and turned against him: he had privileges no one else had. In $YEAR$, within four months, Rasputin had visited the Romanovs six times. The press started a campaign against Rasputin, claiming he paid too much attention to women. Hermogen, who told Rasputin to stay away from the palace, repeated the rumors that Rasputin had joined the Khlysty, a sect. Iliodor, hinting that Rasputin was Alexandra's paramour, showed Makarov a satchel of letters. The letters were handed to the Tzar and Rodzianko requested Rasputin to leave the capital. When Kokovtsov became prime minister he asked the Tzar permission to authorize Rasputin's exile to Tobolsk, but Nicholas refused: "I know Rasputin too well to believe all the tittle-tattle about him." Kokovtsov offered Rasputin 200,000 rubles for him to leave the capital, but he refused. Rasputin had become one of the most hated persons in Russia.
What nonsense is this? Rasputin proved to be a good man time and again.
Something must be done about him.
Rasputin's Exile

\n\nAfter much time spent debating it, the Tzar was finally convinced to exile Rasputin. Tzarina Alexandra is inconsolable, blaming the Tzar if anything happens to their son. The Russian nobility and clergy rejoices, arguing that the Tzar made the right choice. Rasputin only looked the Tzar in the eyes, and said "Before we repent, we have to sin."
No one will miss him.
Russia Goes to War

\n\nDespite attempts to convince the Tzar, Rasputin stayed in court. Iliodor, one of the main orthodox priests, had Khionia Guseva attack Rasputin. She stabbed Rasputin in the stomach, just above the navel. Covered with blood, Rasputin was brought into his house. The Tzar sent his own physician and after a laparotomy and more than six weeks in the hospital, Rasputin recovered. From the hospital Rasputin sent quite a few telegrams to the court, expressing his fears for the future of the country: "If Russia goes to war, it will be the end of the monarchy, of the Romanovs and of Russian institutions." In $YEAR$, Tzar Nicholas took supreme command of the Russian armies, leaving his wife in charge of ruling the country. Alexandra loathed the Duma because of its discussion of Rasputin. While seldom meeting with Alexandra personally, Rasputin had become her personal adviser through daily telephone calls or weekly meetings with Vyrubova. Rumors began on how the one really governing was Rasputin.
The Tzar will lead Russia to glory in the battlefield.
Rasputin's Telegram

When the bell tolls three times, it will announce that I have been killed. If I am killed by common men, you and your children will rule Russia for centuries to come. If I am killed by one of your stock, you and your family will be killed by the Russian people. 
Pray Tzar of Russia.
Pray.
Quick, send orders to protect Rasputin!
Rasputin's Assassination

\n\nTwo city policemen on duty near the Yusupov palace heard shots and screams. They discussed the issue on the Pochtamtsky Bridge. One of them rang at the door and questioned Yusupov's butler, but was sent away. Twenty minutes later he was re-invited to the palace. Purishkevich boasted he had shot Rasputin, and asked the policeman, aware of his mistake, to keep it quiet for the sake of the Tzar. Rasputin's beaver-fur coat and the body were discovered in a frozen river, 140 meters away from the Bolshoy Petrovsky bridge, with a shot in his frontal lobe. The two nobles who killed Rasputin were exiled by the Tzar, who came back from the front. Progressively, more and more people came to the conclusion that the problem was not Rasputin but the weak-willed Emperor, who had secluded himself in Tsarskoye Selo, unable to react on what happened. The struggle between the Tzar and the Duma became more bitter than ever, and the Tzar, more secluded in his palace.
A gruesome end.
The Communist Plot

\n\nEveryone who met Rasputin remarked on his eyes and how hypnotic they were. His "shining steel-like" or "bright and brilliant" and "intelligent" eyes became legendary. According to Theofan, Paul Kurlov and Count Kokotsov he had "piercing" eyes. To Tamara Karsavina he had the eyes of a maniac. But his hypnotic eyes couldn't do anything against the bullet of one of the members of the Communist Party who believed he could destabilize the government by killing a close friend of the Tzar's family and the Tzarina most trusted advisor. The Russian nobility rejoiced at the death of Rasputin, assassinated as he left his home, but the death had the inverse effect that his assassin expected: the Russian Tzar left his isolation and ordered a hunt. The police organized a crackdown in every syndicate or communist party/organization, severely crippling communist support and organization, and rounding up a few suspects including a prominent figure in the communist circles, Vladimir Ilyich Ulyanov.
Attempt on Rasputin's Life

\n\nDuring a visit to his home village, while exiting a church, Rasputin was attacked by a man. The man stabbed him in the belly three times before Rasputin managed to escape, running down the street with his hands on his belly. The man chased him, but Rasputin grabbed a stick from the ground and hit him on the head. Covered with blood, Rasputin was brought into the church. After ten hours a doctor arrived from the neighboring village and operated on him in the middle of the night. Rasputin stayed days under heavy guard and the man who attacked him was never found, but he recovered. He started drinking, his paranoia increased and eventually he asked to leave the service of the Tzar, which he did despite the Royal family protesting, and lived the rest of his life as a hermit. Nobles still went looking for him, asking for advice, and after he left his public image was somewhat redeemed.
At least he will live the rest of his life in peace.
The Third Way

'Black shirts of the revolution, men and women of all $COUNTRY$, men and women all over the world, listen: The government has grown weak! We need a party who can unite us, who can give us a strong national identity and who will not be fooled by capitalism's or communism's sweet but poisonous voice. $COUNTRY$! $COUNTRY$! Entirely and universally Fascist! $COUNTRY$ of the black shirts, rise to your feet, let the cry of your determination rise to the skies and reach all the world: Everything in the State, nothing outside the State, nothing against the State. Today, together in $COUNTRY$ we have lit a flame that the ages shall not extinguish. Guard that sacred flame, my fascist brothers, until it illuminates $COUNTRY$ and lights again the paths of mankind.' 
 
 The Third Way, or fascists as they might be called, are looking to get a seat in the Upper House.
Strength through Unity!
The Libyan Question

\n\nWith the Turkish Empire currently in its weakest state in history, the time for laying claim to the lands of Libya is perfect. We can send an ultimatum to the Turks demanding that they surrender the Libyan territories, threatening war if they refuse. The other Great Powers are quickly laying claim to the rest of Africa, so it is imperative that we seize this opportunity.
We will send an ultimatum to the Turks.
We have no interest in colonial affairs at this time.
Italians Demand Libya!

\n\nApparently looking to join the other powers of Europe in the "Scramble for Africa," the arrogant fools ruling Italy have sent us an ultimatum demanding that we fully surrender our protectorates in Libya. As Libya is currently the least of our worries, it may be best to persuade Italy into accepting a compromise.
We will permit Italian influence in Libya while keeping it as a protectorate.
This is nonsense. We will not let these fools bully us.
Turks Suggest a Compromise

\n\nThe Turks have said that they would be willing to grant independence to their Libyan territories while allowing us unlimited trading rights within said territories. While this would prevent a possibly long and bloody conflict, it would also stall our goals towards further colonization in Africa.
Fine. We agree.
Is this some kind of joke? We demand full control over Libya! §RGain 3 infamy§W
The Italians Agree to Our Compromise
\n\nItaly has agreed to allow us to maintain nominal suzerainty over Libya while granting them full trade access within the territories. This is in our best interests for now.
Very well.
\n\nThe Italians have refused our suggested compromise and continue to demand full control over Libya. Shall we back down and concede or prove our worth in battle?
Italians Refuse Deal
Allah will grant us victory. To battle!.
We concede.
Turks Refuse!
\n\nTurkey has refused our demands once again and threatens to respond militarily if we pursue our interests in Libya. Will we go to war, or will we back down?
To arms!
Bide our time.
The Turkish Concession
\n\nThe Turks have backed down and agreed to grant us full control over Libya. Surely our might is great.
Great!
Let's take Rhodes too. §RGain 1 infamy§W
The Treaty of Ouchy

\n\nOur brave soldiers truly fought with the Lord on their side as the Turks fell to the ground in wave after wave. Libya is now ours. This is truly a glorious day for our nation! Even more fortunate, the Dodecanese Islands rebelled from the their Turkish masters and proclaimed themselves the Federation of the Dodecanese Islands. If we don't intervene, they will surely be suppressed. By intervening, we can take the islands in the name of peace and stability. With our enemies at the negotiating table in Lausanne, we can now impose our demands, including Rhodes if we so wish.
\n\nOur brave soldiers truly fought with the Lord on their side as the Turks fell to the ground in wave after wave. Libya is now ours. This is truly a glorious day for our nation!
Viva Italia!
We have no need for Rhodes.
The island shall be ours! §RGain 2 infamy§W
The Ottoman Empire Prevails
\n\nOur glorious armies have defeated the Italians. Truly Allah is on our side.
Allahu Akbar!

\n\nWith the purchase of Alaska from the Russians many in the US are calling for the immediate annexation of all territory south of the Yukon River. Those in favor of the idea claim that it is our destiny to establish a contiguous federation from Juneau to Tampa. If we follow through with this demand we can rest assured that the British will not be happy.

\n\nThe Americans have issued us an ultimatum. They are demanding we renounce and secede all our possessions along the Yukon River and down the continental divide to the American's newly purchased Alaskan colony. Refusing would most definitely mean a costly war in North America over more sparsely populated territory.
Demobilizing Westernized Country
Demobilizing Westernized Country.
Everything will be alright.
The Grand Campaign.
Let's change a few things that can't be done outside events or are easier to do through here.
Done.
The Russian Civil War
\n\nThe Bolsheviks have started a revolution in our country to topple the existing government and a civil war has emerged
Crush the Bolshevik scum and bring order to Russia! §BPlay the Whites§!
Comrades we have nothing to lose but our chains! §BPlay the Soviets§!

\n\nConscripts are being drafted left and right and the poor are being trained and prepared to fight. Military camps are full of fresh recruits, troops are carrying out exercises in our borders and every aspect of society and every signal the government gives seems to indicate a war is in progress, yet there's no war. This large disruption in the country's daily life is angering our population and making our neighbors increasingly wary.
The $PARTY$ Conference of $YEAR$

While all members of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leadership are loyal, some are beginning to stray from traditional communism. For a while, we have purged these revisionist elements, but these new ideas are subtle, and some secretly envy the success of the West. It is time to stop ignoring these ideas and have an earnest discussion about the path $COUNTRY$ is to take to achieve socialism. Broadly, there are three ideas about this: to continue as we have been, to adopt some free market reforms, or to adopt limited democratic elements. We have gathered our people, but be warned: "The democracy of capitalist society is democracy for the rich."
This is a time of change
Cleanup

There are certain elements among the people who are the sworn enemy of any Marxist state. They are worse than capitalist sympathizers, worse than ethnic nationalists: they are the revisionists, who seek to destroy everything we have so carefully built in for the sake of pushing their own interpretation of socialism. Naturally, this is forbidden in $COUNTRY$. At this crucial point, perhaps it is time to pay them a visit and remind them what being a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizen really means?
Pay them a visit
We cannot turn against our own people!
Monument Protests

The figure stood, alone in front of a column of tanks. He had had enough: the nighttime raids, the disappearances, the control of thought and discourse. Undoubtedly necessary measures of state security. Recently, it is true, there had been some...extra measures taken against a new wave of agitators throughout $COUNTRY$. A swift response, more than they deserved. And yet, if this man feels strongly enough in his convictions to stop the tanks, and if so many have gathered in peaceful protest...\n\nThere is no time for idle thought. The police stand ready to put this man away forever. Just give the word.
Crack down
Proposals from Private Investors

A message we have received recently has completely divided our leadership along ideological lines: a Western corporation wishes to invest in our infrastructure. While we can, of course, direct the investment, it comes with terms one could almost describe as capitalist. Undoubtedly we must build socialism, but how much capitalism can we tolerate if it helps achieve achieve our final result?
We will permit some investment under our direction
Absolutely not!
A McCapitalist

We have received a bizarre request: a multinational fast-food chain has applied to open a branch in $CAPITAL$. Some regard this as the beginning of the end, as multinational corporations are the clearly a new bourgeois imperialism. There is no suitable counter-argument for a true Marxist. Really, it is a laughable proposal.\nA bureaucrat enters the chamber to report that the bread line in $CAPITAL$ has reached record lengths, and has had to lower rations. What's worse, without food, some people are getting strange ideas about our benevolent rule.\nOnce he leaves, the chamber goes quiet. Some officials grimace, others look toward the paintings of our founders on the wall. A moment passes - what were we discussing?
Za Gorbacheva!
Western spies!
Luxury Goods Policy

Recently, some people have begun to openly petition the government for a loosening of restrictions on luxury goods in $COUNTRY$. Whether people just want to eat in restaurants, try out electronics, or simply wear a white suit, they are stirring up trouble and questioning longstanding $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policy.
We must change course so we do not sink.
Bourgeois distractions!
Party Member Requests Religious Funeral

A Party member of some importance has died recently. His family was closely tied to the Revolution, and we were planning the standard mourning events in his home town, but it seems he has put something unusual in his will. We almost missed it among the usual devotions to the party, but it is there: he has clearly requested a funeral in the traditions of his ancestral religion. While the people, and even low-level party members, do this frequently, a practice to which we have turned a blind eye, the funeral of a man such as this, who has monuments in his family's honor, will make waves among the people.
What's the harm? Anything for a hero of the Revolution.
Senile fool! Religion is the opiate of the masses. No funeral.
$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Intervention in $COUNTRY$

After refusing to pay our debt to the $FROMCOUNTRY$, a bloody war ensued. Now, as the result of our latest defeat, the $FROMCOUNTRY$ sent a squadron to enforce their will and collect the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ debt.
We have no other option but to pay.
Haiti Fails to Honor its Debts

\n\nHaiti's legacy of debt began shortly after gaining independence from France in 1804. In 1825, France, with warships at the ready, demanded Haiti compensate France for its loss of slaves and its slave colony. In exchange for French recognition of Haiti as a sovereign republic, France demanded payment of 150 million francs. In addition to the payment, France required that Haiti discount its exported goods to them by 50%. In $YEAR$, France agreed to reduce the debt to 90 million francs (500,000¤) to be paid over a period of 30 years to compensate former plantation owners who had lost their property. Haiti, however, still refuses to pay what is owed to us and will not do so unless we use force.
We will take what is owed to us.
To safeguard French assets, the Haitian government must be controlled. §RGain 5 infamy§W
Clearly, the Haitians are not fit to rule themselves. §RGain 8 infamy§W
They are not worth our time. §GLose 2 infamy§W
Haiti's Debts to France

\n\nHaiti's legacy of debt began shortly after gaining independence from France in 1804. In 1825, France, with warships at the ready, demanded Haiti compensate France for its loss of slaves and its slave colony. In exchange for French recognition of Haiti as a sovereign republic, France demanded payment of 150 million francs. In addition to the payment, France required that Haiti discount its exported goods to them by 50%. In $YEAR$, France agreed to reduce the debt to 90 million francs to be paid over a period of 30 years to compensate former plantation owners who had lost their property. This is the best deal we can get, and refusing to honor our debt will likely result in French intervention.
We must honor our agreements.§R(Pay or owe 500,000¤)§W
We owe nothing to the French.
The Greater Finnish language debate

Now that we have formed the first sovereign Uralic country in hundreds of years, the Finnish people are fiercely debating how we're gonna treat the other non-Finnish Uralic people. My question to you, mr. president is this: Does Suur-Suomi represent Uralic unity or Finnish irredentism?
All Uralic people are our brothers!
The Finnish language is more important!

\n\nWith the wave of unrest that has blanketed Europe reaching the Prussian Partition of the former Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, Poles in Poznan have launched a military insurrection against our forces in an attempt to obtain independence, eject the Prussian military and re-unite Poland. Polish militiamen lead by the infamous revolutionary Ludwik Mieroslawski who also took part in the November Uprising of 1830 in Russia have already won several small skirmishes with the local garrisons. On the other hand, however, German inhabitants of Poznan have also begun forming militia units to oppose the Polish revolutionaries and protect their interests. We must act swiftly to put out this spark of revolution before it becomes a roaring blaze.
The War of Scandinavia!

\n\nOkay, enough is enough! This was not a part of the deal. Norway and Sweden would share the same king and that's it! If we want to bump up our defenses, we do so without anyone intervening. Sweden taking away our autonomy is a direct violation of the Moss convention! Denmark has promised to help us if Sweden attacks us but we have to make the first move of refusing annexation.
Sweden is once again the hegemon of Scandinavia!

\n\nWe have now proven that even with all of Scandinavia against us, we are still the strongest. Even the War of Scandinavia wasn't a match for our might. We can now annex Norway, take Bornholm and all of Denmark's colonies. The world will now think twice before poking Sweden as we are now practically a great power ourselves! We have long dreamed about a direct port to the Atlantic ocean, now we have the longest coastline in Europe! Sweden is now the undisputed hegemon of Scandinavia!
Norway and Denmark won the War of Scandinavia!

\n\nNorway hasn't won a war against Sweden since 1099 and together with our brothers overseas in Denmark, we asserted our dominance over the so-called "Lion of the North". Now, let's take back what's rightfully ours and leave Sweden to rot in the mud, for Sweden is now weak and will most likely never see its prime ever again. Celebrations will be held all over Norway as we are now independent for the first time since 1380!
Denmark and Norway won the War of Scandinavia!

\n\nOur arch-rivals have been stomped by the mighty Denmark. We thought our prime was over after the loss of Norway in the Napoleonic wars, but it seems we were wrong. Denmark is as strong as it has always been. Together with our Norwegian brothers overseas, we will take back what was stolen from us and leave Sweden to rot in the mud, for Sweden is now weak and will most likely never see its prime ever again.
The Norwegians

\n\nIt is no coincidence that the continental territories were left with after 1809 were the only Swedish-speaking lands in the world! If we want to prevent this from ever happening again, we need to aggressively impose Swedification of the revived Swedish Empire to make Norway once more the home of Swedes! On the other hand, it's immoral to destroy precious cultures and personal freedoms just to fulfill our dreams of Swedification. What is your say in the matter, my king?
Mecklenburg's loan on Wismar has defaulted!

\n\nFrom 7th of January of 1632 to 1803, almost 200 years, we were in control of the German-speaking city of Wismar but in 1803, we pledged both the town and lordship to Mecklenburg-Schwerin for 1,258,000 Riksdaler, reserving, however, the right of redemption after 100 years. In view of this contingent right of Sweden, Wismar was not represented at the diet of Mecklenburg until 1897. In 1903, we historically renounced our claims on the town.
Sweden is demanding back Wismar!

\n\nIn 1803, Sweden loaned Wismar to Mecklenburg for some cash for a hundred years. Now, that loan has defaulted and Sweden is demanding Wismar back. Of course, we could just break the deal and keep it but that would be seen as an aggressive move as we are breaking a deal we've written with Sweden.
German response!
\n\nThey refused to return Wismar to us and has officially broken our agreement!
The Béchar Conflict

\n\nBéchar has become a destination for many fleeing Algerian rebels. Abd al-Qadir's army has fled there to launch guerrilla attacks across the Moroccan border with impunity. We must act and demand that the Moroccans hand over Béchar to us so that we may combat the Algerians.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ demands Béchar!

\n\n$FROMCOUNTRY$ is demanding one our far-flung holdings in the Sahara, as the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ accuse us of harboring the Algerian resistance under Abd al-Qadir they're suppressing. Of course they're wrong, but we're powerless to convince them of this now. What do we do, my sultan?
The Moroccans refuse!
\n\nThe Moroccans refuse to leave Béchar to us. They're forcing us to be aggressive!
The Algerian Struggle

\n\nEmir Abdelkader, leading the Algerians in their conflict with the French menace, needs all the assistance he can get to ensure victory. If we give his forces access to Morocco, they will have a slight advantage due to being able to retreat, travel through and recover in safe neutral territory. If we allow Algeria to fall, we may well be next. This will, however, worsen our relations with the French. On the other hand, this Algerian defense seems hopeless and it might be better if we supported the ivaders instead.
Samuel Lafone and the Camp

\n\nSamuel Fisher Lafone, a British merchant operating from Montevideo, has had a contract with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government in the Falkland Islands since 1846 due to the lucrative cattle herding business. An absentee landlord, Lafone maintained control through armed gauchos, who eventually had hunted down the feral cattle population to near extinction by 1852. Due to this, sheep farming has been introduced to the islands, helping their economy greatly.
Excellent!
A $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Research Station in South Georgia!

\n\nNow that a permanent whaling settlement, Grytviken, has been created, it finally allowed us to establish a meteorological research station in the island, owned by the Ministry of Agriculture and by the Argentine Fishing Company, created by the Norwegian founder of Grytviken.
Glory to the scientific progress of our nation!
Johann "Juan" Gödeken's colonies

\n\nA large quantity of German settlers have been establishing small towns in lands without roads or any real population around the border of our provinces of Santa Fe and Córdoba, with the most prominent of these settlers being Johann "Juan" Gödeken, born in Bremen, who has been founding large quantities of towns in the region. There are proposals in $CAPITAL$ to help grow his colonies and develop the area even further, something that has a lot of potential to benefit us, but would be quite expensive.
This is not needed, we shall not interfere.
A great initiative! Send as much help as we can! §R(Pay or owe 120,000¤)§W.
$COUNTRY$'s 100 Year Anniversary

\n\nOn the 25th of May, 1810, the embers of revolution ignited, the chains that held us to the claw of the Iberian Lion were cut forevermore. A defiant roar that would culminate in the freedom of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ state. This pivotal date stands as the foundational date of our nation, a day that would ultimately forge this glorious country. One hundred years have swept by since our people shouted: Libertad! Libertad! Libertad!
Glory to $COUNTRY$!

\n\nAt 8:36PM, a very powerful earthquake hit Mendoza in western Argentina, engulfing the city in disaster. As it was evening, people were either asleep in bed or indoors with benzine lamps to provide light. When the ground began to shake, the walls collapsed in on them, crushing thousands. Rubble falling into channels led to flooding in parts of the town, while others were set ablaze by the lamps. Five thousand perished in the tragedy. Two thousand homes, the colonial-era town hall and the Basilica of San Francisco were leveled, the remains burning to ash in the ensuing four-day fire. Thankfully, illnesses that would have been caused by leaving the dead to decay were avoided by transporting them to mass graves in the capital.
Tragic!
The Reconstruction of Mendoza

\n\nAfter the devastating 1861 earthquake, a large part of the city of Mendoza was destroyed. Following the plan designed by the engineer Julio Balloffet, the city was rebuilt in a new nearby place, located approximately 1 kilometer to the southwest, and the authorities moved to the new seat shortly after. The design of the new city was intended for the rapid evacuation of the inhabitants in the face of a new seismic emergency. For this, wider streets and a greater number of squares were designed, which would serve as a quick refuge for the neighbors.
Excellent!

\n\nWriter José Hernández has authored an epic poem titled 'Martín Fierro' or 'El Gaucho Martín Fierro'. The poem supplies a historical link to the gauchos' contribution to the national development of $COUNTRY_ADJ$, for the gaucho have played a major role in $COUNTRY$'s independence from Spain. The story touches on the abuses and stigmatization suffered by the gauchos, and it has become an almost instant classic.

\n\n"La Revolución del Parque" (The revolution of the park) was an uprising against the national government of $COUNTRY$ that took place on July 26, 1890, and started with the takeover of the Buenos Aires Artillery Park. It was led by members of the Unión Cívica against the presidency of Miguel Juárez Celman of the Autonomista Nacional Party. Though it failed in its main goals, the revolution forced Celman's resignation.

\n\nIn 1865, Father Damiaan De Veuster, a priest from Tienen in Brabant, departed with a ship to the island of Molokai in Hawaii to aid the lepers colony there. Many natives are being infected by diseases such as influenza, brought by foreign sailors and traders. Other diseases, such as the currently incurable leprosy, also affect a great part of the population. Father Damiaan plans to work and live with the lepers on Molokai for many years, showing true dedication to aiding those in need even though this trip may be considered a death sentence for him.

\n\nOnce again Uruguay has attempted to liberate themselves from our rule, resulting in a humiliating defeat. After the failed revolt in Montevideo, a great debate has arisen in $CAPITAL$: the fate of Uruguay. Although there are many ideas, our options come down to two: integrate them officially as a province of $COUNTRY$ or grant them independence under strict $COUNTRY_ADJ$ supervision. What shall be done with the rebellious Banda Oriental?

\n\nWe have succeeded in our fight for independence against the Argentines and, in $YEAR$, we have proclaimed a Uruguay free from foreign domination. It is now time to celebrate this crucial victory for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people.
Formation of the Shishi

\n\nA band of politically-inclined ronin discontent with the Shogunate has formed. The Shishi, or "men of higher purpose," hail primarily from Satsuma, Choshu, and Tosa, and they are prepared to take violent action to thwart Shogunal policies that would further put Japan under foreign influence. This is to say, not all of the shishi explicitly support bringing the Shogun down. But all of them believe a change of course in foreign policy is necessary to save Japan from foreign domination. To this end, they are willing to engage in terrorism, no matter the cost to national stability.
Whatever it takes to set Japan on the right path.
Formation of the Shishi

\n\nA band of politically-inclined ronin discontent with the Shogunate has formed. The Shishi, or "men of higher purpose," hail primarily from Satsuma, Choshu, and Tosa, and they are prepared to take violent action to thwart Shogunal policies that would further put Japan under foreign influence. This is to say, not all of the shishi explicitly support bringing the Shogun down. But all of them believe a change of course in foreign policy is necessary to save Japan from foreign domination. To this end, they are willing to engage in terrorism, no matter the cost to national stability.
The unrest grows worse each day.
The Ikedaya Incident

\n\nResentment of the Shogun's weak policy against the foreign powers continues to fester among samurai from other domains. The prominent group of discontent ronin known as the Shishi has plotted violence in Kyoto in order to promote the cause of the Emperor's restoration to power. Last night, they convened at the Ikedaya inn in Kyoto, where they were ambushed by the Shinsengumi. The ensuing confrontation saw the two groups in intense battle within the inn. Reinforcements from the Shinsengumi ensured their victory. The battle, however, has contributed even more to growing calls for Imperial restoration.
The Shogunate shall reap what they sow.
The Ikedaya Incident

\n\nResentment of the Shogun's weak policy against the foreign powers continues to fester among samurai from other domains. The prominent group of discontent ronin known as the Shishi has plotted violence in Kyoto in order to promote the cause of the Emperor's restoration to power. Last night, they convened at the Ikedaya inn in Kyoto, where they were ambushed by the Shinsengumi. The ensuing confrontation saw the two groups in intense battle within the inn. Reinforcements from the Shinsengumi ensured their victory. The battle, however, has contributed even more to growing calls for Imperial restoration.
We will crush all opposition.
The Ikedaya Incident

\n\nResentment of the Shogun's weak policy against the foreign powers continues to fester among samurai from other domains. The prominent group of discontent ronin known as the Shishi has plotted violence in Kyoto in order to promote the cause of the Emperor's restoration to power. Last night, they convened at the Ikedaya inn in Kyoto, where they were ambushed by the Shinsengumi. The ensuing confrontation saw the two groups in intense battle within the inn. Reinforcements from the Shinsengumi ensured their victory. The battle, however, has contributed even more to growing calls for Imperial restoration.
Civil war is coming soon.
The State of the Modern Shogunate

\n\nJapan has changed, yet it also seems the same as usual. In a race against the clock to modernize its military and social institutions to protect itself from Western imperialism, it has established a Prussian-esque semi-constitutional monarchy, and has otherwise adopted the government institutions of a modern country. Daily life, however, continues more or less as it did during Japan's isolated era. The Shogun is still a supreme military ruler, and the conflict of his agenda with that of the Emperor has not disappeared. Meanwhile, the populace has continued to maintain a severe distrust of all things Western, except the newfound wealth brought to the upper class from industrialization. Social mobility continues to be stifled by the divide between the peasant and samurai classes, which are inherited, mutually exclusive statuses. Both classes seek prestige and higher wages by either joining the national army or the Shinsengumi police force. In short, it's a status quo the Japanese people have been used to for hundreds of years.
Let us rejoice, though, that Japan is stronger than ever before.
The Assassination of Sakuma Shozan

\n\nSakuma Shozan, also known as Sakuma Zozan, was a scholar of European technology and military strategy. Single-handedly, he studied the works of European scientists and engineers, then adopted their machines' schematics to create his own technology. His machines ranged from electrical generators to clocks to Japan's first telegraph. He also was a staunch advocate for opening Japan's ports to Western trade, which made him an enemy of the Shogunate. In $YEAR$, he was murdered by a group of assassins for his belief that the Emperor should move his castle to Hikone province, which roused the ire of the pro-Shogunate Hikone and Aizu clans. For the few who share his pro-Western convictions, he is a martyr. They would be sorely disappointed if the Emperor did not take heed to Sakuma's ideas after his passing.
May the heavens grant him eternal rest.

\n\nDuring our righteous war against the savage federalists, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forces have finally occupied Entre Rios and reached the Parana Delta. The province has been assigned to be governed by a local unitarian, who will also rally troops and lead them to fight against Rosas' regime. However, the province of Entre Rios is largely federalist, and the local population will certainly be angered and might attempt to revolt.

\n\nWith Rosas unable to defeat the Corrientes rebellion, Colonel Astrada has assumed control of the government. Meeting with other unitarians in the country, they have drawn up a new constitution for Argentina. The Argentine Confederation was abolished and replaced by the unitarian-led Argentine Republic, with Genaro Berón de Astrada as president while the former Governor and President, Juan Manuel de Rosas, was forced to flee the country and is now exiled in the United Kingdom.
Resistance to New Japanese regime

\n\nFederal Japanese government officials have been hard-pressed to get the former daimyos and the samurai class to accept the new regime. There is a good deal of the population who are skeptical, if not hostile, to our rise to power. They prefer a return to the old ways of feudalism--and they are channeling their foolish nostalgia through civil unrest.
They will get used to us, eventually.
Resistance to the New Japanese Regime Dies Down

\n\nWith a new high standard of living, modernized industry, and a prevailing sense of hope for Japan's future, the Japanese people are quickly adapting to our rule. They are no longer openly resisting the government, and instead are voicing their contentment with the direction of their newly modernized nation.
We knew they would come to their senses.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Launches Invasion of Manchuria

\n\nTheir victory in the Russo-Japanese War has emboldened $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ forces to invade Manchuria. This is the latest step in their expansion of holdings in northeastern Asia. If they are able to annex Manchuria, what will that mean for our country's security in the future?
Bloody Sunday

With our military's reputation being tarnished due to recent defeats, unrest has begun blanketing the peasant class of Saint Petersburg, sparking protests against larger socioeconomic inequality. Led by Georgy Gapon, a pro-Tsarist priest with a particular sympathy toward the poor, a crowd of unarmed protesters marched onto Narva Gate and attempted reaching the Winter Palace to address the Tsar. They carried the Imperial banner to signify their support of the Tsar, simply wanting to talk to him. The Tsar was not at the palace. The Imperial Guard, unprovoked, responded to the crowd by firing upon them. Up to 234 civilians were killed, up to 800 injured, and 6,831 arrested. 

This massacre has disastrous implications for the monarchy. With it now established that the Imperial Army is not afraid to fire upon the Tsar's loyal subjects, the Russian people have no reason to believe the monarchy represents them.
Grand Duke Sergei Alexandrovich Assassinated

The peasant unrest grows more and more severe, claiming its latest victim within the Russian royal family--the Grand Duke, Sergei Alexandrovich. Ivan Kalyayev, a terrorist from the Revolutionary Socialist Party, stalked the Duke as he rode a carriage through the Kremlin. When the carriage crossed through Nikolsky Gate, Kalyayev threw a nitroglycerin bomb directly into the Duke's lap. The explosion instantly killed the Duke and mutilated his body almost beyond recogntion. 

Sergei is remembered for his extreme methods putting down revolutionary movements. He was not afraid to shed the blood of hundreds of Russian subjects to maintain the Tsar's rule. With him gone, the budding anti-Tsar revolution can claim new heights.
The Lódz Insurrection

\n\nThe Poles of Russia are joining in on the revolutionary fervor. Facing the same economic suffering as other Russian peasant subjects, as well as suppression of Polish culture and the Polish language under Russification, agitators have begun a violent uprising in Lódz. The uprising was supported by Polish socialists, though was notably opposed by the National Democrats. Wishing instead to promote cultural unity with Russians and increased Polish political representation, the National Democrats collaborated with the Imperial Army to put down the rebellion. Nevertheless, nationalist and socialist agitation is now spreading across Poland--a specter haunting the land.
The Council of Elders' First Session

\n\nThe newly established Japanese national assembly, the Council of Elders, is meeting officially for the first time. The Council has been addressed by our leader with opening remarks about Japan's continued modernization, as well as the need for our new government to establish its legitimacy in the people's eyes. He ponders his words as he speaks, as if coming to terms with the new contradiction he is presented with as he takes on his new office. The Sonno Joi movement cast him as a leader of a new order meant to bring Japan to new heights, a liberal icon. Yet as a religiously-appointed sovereign, his authority is by no means a hallmark of liberalism. Which faction should our ruler come out in support of? What will be exact words?
Kiri-sute Gomen

Throughout pre-modern Japan, samurai had the right to kill peasants whom they perceived to have insulted their honor. The practice was known as Kiri-sute Gomen, literally the "right to cut down and leave [the victim's body]." Today, however, in an age of both revitalization and re-analysis of tradition, the practice has become controversial. 

In the streets of Tokyo, a particularly grisly instance of Kiri-sute Gomen occurred when a samurai kicked a peasant to the ground and stabbed him through the heart. The incident unfolded directly in view of a House of Elders member, who was disgusted by the act. He has thus brought the old right to the House of Elders for a vote on its repeal.
Japonisme

\n\nThe West has always shown curiosity in the customs of the East. Their exoticness--their non-Christian faiths, their unique art--both inspires and bewilders viewers who are accustomed to the established traditions of Western culture. Japanese art and culture has now reached a new height of popularity in the West. Romanticists, impressionists, and the generally curious have begun using Japanese-inspired styles, painting Japanese subjects, and even mimicking Japanese fashion sense through donning kimono. The trend of obsession with Japanese culture has been termed "Japonisme." This trend is a double-edged sword: while many Westerners genuinely appreciate our culture, some do so out of a morbid curiosity about what they perceive as an exotic, uncivilized nation--a society attempting to match the West's greatness with their curious traditions. Nevertheless, we will use Japonisme to cement our cultural dominance worldwide.
The Shinsengumi Turn against the Shogun

\n\nTrends toward liberalism and the political left have turned the Shogun-loyalist Shinsengumi, currently serving as Japan's elite police force, against our government. They are highly nationalist, seeing our modernization as an unjust drift toward emulating the West rather than differentiating us from them. They believe our government's reforms contradict Dentoudou: we claim to preserve our traditions while undermining the old order of our society. They have issued a warning: if we continue to drift leftward, they will start a rebellion.
The Shinsengumi Rebellion

\n\nThe Shinsengumi has declared that our rule is now illegitimate in their eyes. They have declared war on the Shogun, inciting sympathizers in the army to engage us and topple the government. Kansai is now a hotbed of reactionary fervor and violence. Japan has entered its second civil war in this century.
The Shinsengumi's Demands

\n\nWith our army struggling to contain the rebellion, the Shinsengumi has seen it fit to submit their demands. They wish to install their leader, Hijikata Toshizo, as the new Shogun. Additionally, they wish to revert the Shogunate to an absolute monarchy, giving the Shogun free reign to enforce an isolationist, traditionalist agenda. They have only vaguely specified the Emperor's role in their new government: some speculation is to be made about whether he will continue as speaker for the House of Elders or take on an entirely new role. If the Shinsengumi get their way, they will be given free reign to roll back modernization reforms.
The End of the Shinsengumi Rebellion

\n\nThe Shinsengumi are demoralized and have stopped fighting. The Shogun emerges victorious, and our victory has led to reactionaries nationwide losing organization and political relevance. The Shogunate has now disbanded the Shinsengumi and will purge the army of their sympathizers and collaborators.
The $YEAR$ Russian Constitution

\n\nWe now have the opportunity to solve the question plaguing our politics today: the fate of Russia's absolute monarchy. Should the $YEAR$ Constitution pass, Russia will become a constitutional monarchy with a bicameral parliamentary system. The federal legislative branch will include two assembly bodies: the State Council, consisting half of Tsar-appointed officials and half elected by the people, and the State Duma, entirely composed of elected representatives. This is a last resort to prevent the Tsardom's total destruction. Then again, the Tsar still steadfastly holds on to the belief that the Russian people are too unintelligent to know how to represent themselves. If we break our promise in the October Manifesto to establish this constitution, we may spare the Tsar some peace of mind--at the cost of guaranteeing a huge uprising down the road.
The Moscow Uprising

A socialist-communist coalition of rebels have descended upon our great city of Moscow. While the new constitution was able to satisfy liberals, who demanded expanded political rights, socialists and communists were left dissatisfied because of unsolved worker's rights issues. The rebels were brought to action by the rousing words of Vladimir Lenin, the infamous Marxist leader himself, who called for an armed uprising. The preparations for this uprising were in place shortly afterward, and the catalyst for the revolt came when the Saint Petersburg Soviet communist group's members were all arrested. 

Before violence broke out, though, about 2 million Moscovites went on strike peacefully, After police violently intervened, rebels clashed with them, then carried out attacks on the Guard Ministry and the Kremlin itself. Moscow is a war zone.
The Nizhni Novgorod Uprising

\n\nA factory uprising in Nizhni Novgorod has ballooned into a revolt engulf the entire city. After workers from multiple left-wing groups, including the Social Democrats and Socialist Revolutionaries, prepared improvised weapons from industrial steel and gathered guns from donations, they clashed with the military and turned the city into a war zone. The rebels seem to have taken inspiration from the Moscow Uprising. We suspect that the left-wing unrest could create more uprisings in a chain reaction.
The Rostov Uprising

\n\nThe Moscow Uprising's chain reaction has led to another uprising, this time in Rostov. Left-wing worker rebels have engaged the police and military throughout the city after first occupying the city railway station, resulting in the rebels being bombarded with artillery. The violence has also spilled into the neighboring city of Taganrog--where military-trained workers squads are mobilizing against Tsarist troops. Both cities are engulfed in continued warfare.
Uprisings Engulf Ukraine

\n\nSocialist and communist elements in Ukraine have risen up, creating several breakaway "republics" instating policies they demand all of Russia to implement. In Kiev, students and factory workers declared a socialist "republic" in the neighborhood of Shulyavka. They called for an end to monarchy, expanded social programs, and an end to Jewish pogroms. In Gorlovka, more than 4,000 factory workers took up arms against Tsarist forces, protesting decreased wages. Similar violence erupted in Priluki and Yekaterinoslav as well.

\n\nThe $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government are proposing that our current overlapping claims on the Puna de Atacama region be resolved via arbitration with United States minister to Argentina, William Buchanan, mediating the conflict. If we were to accept this proposal it is possible some of our claims might be awarded to $FROMCOUNTRY$. However, this arbitration is our opportunity to set a fixed border in the region and prevent a war. While we may lose some of our claims, it is also possible we are awarded our rightful lands.
The Stary Buyan Republic

\n\nUnrest from militant socialist and communist elements has led to a daring measure being made by the village of Stary Buyan, in Samara. Known for being a revolutionary socialist hotbed since the 1880's, the peasant village has declared itself an independent socialist republic. The "republic's" leaders know this secession is mostly symbolic, since the Russian army's might would easily crush them. Nevertheless, they hope the Tsar will take heed to the budding socialist revolution's demands.
The Krasnoyarsk Republic

A second symbolic secession from $COUNTRY$ has occurred within the city of Krasnoyarsk. After a general strike by the local workers, continuing a trend of strikes originating in Moscow, armed worker's squads formed to enforce the demands of the newly formed Krasnoyarsk Worker's Soviet. The Soviet established an assembly of 120 leaders to consolidate its organization. The Soviet's smooth rise to power was quickly quashed, however, when armed workers battled reactionaries as a pogrom was carried out in the Krasnoyarsk's downtown. 

All that's left to wonder: which city will be the next to rise up?
The Sochi Republic

\n\nSocial Democratic and Communist elements have declared a Soviet Republic in Sochi and Gelendzhik, Krasnodar Krai. Under violent retaliation from Tsarist forces, the two cities are embroiled in open warfare. The rebels, however, became numerically superior to the local police garrison and now have forced the government to send in the army. We may as well consider this conflict another civil war with a breakaway state, part of the continued anti-Tsar revolution.
The Latvian Uprising

\n\nSpirited by the Moscow uprising, Latvian workers have declared a general strike and subsequently clashed with police. Their demands, echoing those of other striking workers in Russia, include increased pay and increased autonomy for the Baltic states. The uprising was spearheaded by the Latvian Social Democratic Workers Party, which advocates for the Russian Empire's split into a decentralized union of autonomous states. They greatly resent Russification and the cooperation of Baltic Germans with Russian authorities as Latvia's autonomy is continuously undermined. Violence has become especially severe in Ventspils and Valmiera.

\n\nThe cities of Viedma and Carmen de Patagones have been economically diversified since their foundation, and export various different products, aside from being mostly self-sufficient. However, there has been a recent amount of sheep coming from Buenos Aires, and this might be an opportunity to exploit the wool business in the city.
The Mutiny of the Battleship Potemkin

Amidst the chaos erupting from the leftist elements in Crimea, the Battleship Kniaz Potemkin Tavricheskiy, or Prince Potemkin of Taurida, has gone rogue. The crew mutinied after morale plummeted due to the Russian military's repeated losses and the resulting disruption of supply lines, which forced the crew to eat borscht rations made from rotting meat. When the crew refused to eat the rations, Ippolit Gillarovsky, the ship's second in command, threatened to shoot them. In the aftermath, a showdown between the ship's officers and the other crewmates erupted and caused seven of the thirteen officers to be killed. 

The Potemkin is now without any naval command, on to parts unknown.
Battleship Potemkin's Crew Takes Refuge in Constanta

\n\nThe Russian Battleship Potemkin has landed in our waters, the crew seeking refuge from the upheaval in their native country. This presents us with a dilemma. Should these sailors seek refuge here and become civilians? Should they be offered enlistment in our own navy? Or, should we return them to Russia in hopes we avoid a diplomatic row with them?
Battleship Potemkin's Crew Takes Refuge in Constanta

\n\nPotemkin has been sighted on the shores of Constanta. It is confirmed that the crew is seeking asylum in $FROMCOUNTRY$. In the midst of our constant unrest, it may be wise to let this incident go, though there is always the opportunity to demand military retaliation if we are so inclined.
The Potemkin's Crew has been Repatriated
\n\nThe Potemkin's mutinous crew has been repatriated graciously by $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ authorities. They will be summarily prosecuted, and the Potemkin will go back into service under a new crew.
The Potemkin's Crew has been Repatriated
\n\nOur military action in order forcibly repatriate the Potemkin's crew was successful. The mutineers will be summarily prosecuted, and the Potemkin will go back into service under a new crew.
The Potemkin Shells Odessa

\n\nAfter the crew mutinied and killed seven of its thirteen officers, the Potemkin has arrived again in Russian waters to deliver sailors attending the funeral of Grigory Vakulinchuk, one of the mutiny leaders. The Russian army then ambushed the attendees and arrested them. In the chaos, crewmembers on the ship retaliating by bombarding the army. Odessa is now under martial law, with the electrical grid cut.
Japanese Warship Visits Manila

Japan's modernization and resistance to the West is now an oft pointed-to inspiration for Philippine revolutionaries. The positive relationships our diplomats have cultivated with the Katipunan have led to us being a role model for the struggling colony. As a result, the battleship Kongo has arrived on a goodwill trip in Manila to greet the revolutionaries. Behind closed doors, however, rumors are circulating about arms deals having been brokered between us and the rebels. Spain has heard of this and now looks upon us with great suspicion. 

Openly allying the rebels can help us further our cause of greater Asian sovereignty. However, it's also tempting to exploit the rebels by kicking out the Spanish together and taking the islands for ourselves.
The Japanese-Philippine Alliance

\n\nThe Katipunan now has a powerful new ally: $FROMCOUNTRY$. Japanese officials confirm that the nation's military will support the rebels as part of a global campaign for Asian sovereignty. This certainly means imminent war.
Spain Threatens War!

\n\nSpanish officials have responded to our alliance with the Katipunan with a warning that war would break out immediately should we not retract our alliance. We have no intention of doing so. It is time for Japan for strike at one of its Western rivals and come out on top.
What Shall We Demand from Spain?

Victory over Spain yields us plenty of options to make demands from them. We initially declared our alliance with the Katipunan intending to fight for Asian sovereignty. However, our geopolitical interests in southeast Asia make it tempting to assume control over the Philippines ourselves, betraying that alliance. One thing is clear, though: Spain can no longer have a foothold in the Pacific. We will need to seize their islands in Micronesia to create a buffer around the Philippines. 

Note: If Spain does not own Palau, Saipan, Guam, or any other Pacific islands, they will not be ceded.
Japan Presents their Demands
\n\nJapan demands that the Philippines be freed from our rule, and that our surrounding Pacific possessions be ceded to Japanese control.
Japan Presents their Demands

\n\nJapan demands that the Philippines be freed from our rule and be placed under their appointed puppet government. Furthermore, all our Pacific island territories surrounding the Philippines will be ceded to Japan.
Japan Presents their Demands

\n\nJapan has performed a dramatic turnaround in their policy regarding the Philippines. Betraying their alliance with the Katipunan to fight for the colony's independence, they demand that the Philippines and all other Spanish-held Pacific islands be annexed.
Our Demands to Japan

\n\nConsidering the disgraceful aggression Japan has displayed toward us, we have drafted a harsh but fair set of demands. They will pay us £200,000 in reparations and cede to us all outlying islands within their realm--including ones close to their major population centers. We will take the Ryukyus, Tsushima, and Sado.
Spain Presents their Demands

\n\nAfter their victory over us, Spain demands our total withdrawal of diplomatic relations with the native Philippine people, and that all our outlying island territories be ceded to them. This includes the small islands closest to our largest regions, including the Ryukyu islands, Tsushima, and Sado.
The Caribbean Revolution

\n\nWord of our defeat by Japan has reached Cuba and Puerto Rico, leading independence activists to immediately stage a revolt against Spanish rule. They waited for the perfect opportunity--a moment when our army is reeling from a major defeat and unable to protect our remaining overseas possessions.
Aftermath of Revolutionaries' Defeat in the Caribbean Revolution
