\n\nThe revolution has been crushed. Cuban and Puerto Rican nationalists have temporarily laid down their arms, but continue to spread pro-independence sentiment among the colonies' populace. To stop the indepndence movement from rising up again, we need to continue ruling over the Caribbean territories with an iron fist.
Korea Revolts after Japanese Loss to Spain

\n\nAfter our humiliating defeat at Spain's hands, the Korean people have taken to open revolt to throw off the chains of our colonial rule. They sensed our military's weakness, unable to defend our foreign territories, and launched the revolt by storming government buildings across the peninsula. Korean former soldiers in our army distributed arms to as many able-bodied men as possible, while women and children took to the streets with Korean flags while chanting the independence slogan "Daehan dokrib manse!" The Japanese government has lost its ability to govern the colony.
Shall we Intervene in Korea?

\n\nThe troubles in Korea continue to roil as pro-independence forces clash with the Japanese army. The conflict engulfs the land and signals a point of great Japanese weakness. Should they lose Korea, Japan will be stripped of its strategic position in north-east Asia. This gives us the opportunity to reassert our dominance in the region. Korea is valuable as a buffer state between us and Japan--and the more loyal they are to us, the better. Shall we send troops to help the Koreans?
Russia aids Korea

\n\nOur troops are now fighting two enemies in the Korean War of Independence. Russia has begun sending troops and materiel to support the Korean revolutionaries, hoping to rebuild Korea as an independent state blocking us from military access to continental Asia. The war has not developed in Japan's favor.
Shall we Intervene in the Caribbean?

\n\nSpain's defeat at the Japanese's hands has led to revolutionaries in Cuba and Puerto Rico revolting, striking during a perfect opportunity at a point of peak Spanish weakness. The Monroe Doctrine obligates us to keep Europe from interfering in Latin America, which is our backyard. We could honor the Doctrine by declaring war on Spain. This will allow us to advance the cause of Latin American sovereignty, or possibly exploit the rebels to get territorial concessions from the Spanish. What shall we do?
What Shall we Demand from Spain?

\n\nOur victory against Spain during our intervention in the Caribbean yields us some options for profitable demands from them. We can guarantee independence for the Spanish West Indies, or we could either vassalize or annex them directly--betraying our alliance with the revolutionaries. The choice is ours.
Filipinos Respond to the Japanese's Betrayal

Midday yesterday, Katipunan members marched to the Spanish governor general's building to proclaim victory over the Spanish, escorted by Japanese troops. By the time the Katipunan fighters reached the steps, however, the Japanese troops pushed them aside and blocked off the entrance. Pamphlets circulated the city within a few hours containing a startling message: the Philippine Islands would become subject to full Japanese jurisdiction, and all independence fighters were to surrender their arms and announce their allegiance to the Japanese government or face deportation. A shootout occurred between indignant resistance members and the Japanese troops at the Governor General building, which then led to skirmishes breaking out nationwide. 

The Philippines have succumbed to a devilish ruse from a supposed ally. They ask Japan: "Have they no shame?"
Cubans and Puerto Ricans Respond to the Americans' Betrayal

\n\nThe populace of Cuba and Puerto Rico have reacted poorly to coming under American rule. After our troops marched into the Spanish capitols in Havana and San Juan and declared the islands are now under US jurisdiction, independence advocates gathered outside and began rioting. Led to believe we would fight for their independence, they feel betrayed. They are not wrong.
The Americans Submit their Demands
\n\nThe victorious United States have sent their demands: total independence for Cuba and Puerto Rico. We will be deprived of our foothold in the Caribbean entirely.
The Americans Submit their Demands
\n\nThe victorious United States have sent their demands: the release of Cuba and Puerto Rico as American vassal states. We will be deprived of our foothold in the Caribbean entirely.
The Americans Submit their Demands
\n\nThe victorious United States have sent their demands: vassalage for Cuba and annexation of Puerto Rico. We will be deprived of our foothold in the Caribbean entirely.
The Americans Submit their Demands
The victorious United States have sent their demands: total annexation of Cuba and Puerto Rico. We will be deprived of our foothold in the Caribbean entirely.
Aftermath of the Korean Defeat

\n\nThe Korean revolutionaries are battered and demoralized, but their convictions stay the same. It will take a long while before Koreans as a whole are willing to submit to Japan as their legitimate overlord. Meanwhile, the colonial government slowly is returning to authority, with heavy backing from the army. We must be ever vigilant to avoid another revolt.
The United States Intervene in the Caribbean Revolution

\n\nAmerican troops have disembarked to engage our forces in the West Indies, providing backup for the Cuban and Puerto Rican rebels. There's no doubt the United States wish to exploit the revolt for their own gain, possibly to get territorial concessions out of us.

\n\nThe Pacts of May, four protocols proposed in Santiago de Chile by Chile and Argentina on 28 May, 1902 in order to extend their relations and resolve its territorial disputes, are being negotiated. The pacts include selling off warships already in construction in Europe and working towards resolution of territorial disputes. If we were to sign these protocols, we could possibly lose part or all of our disputed claims on the Andes. However, refusing them could lead to possible war...

\n\nThe governments of $FROMCOUNTRY$ and Argentina find themselves in a dispute over their borders in the southern Andes mountain range. Argentina claims it lies along the highest peaks of the mountains, while Chile's claim states the border to follow the fluvial watershed. Both countries have signed an agreement to end this dispute on friendly terms, and we have been contacted to arbitrate this dispute. Who shall the land go to?

\n\nWilliam Lane, an Australian socialist, along with some 240 settlers, has come to our nation in the search to create his very own socialist utopia. The settlers were required to pay a minimum of 60 pounds to join the colony, and the small settlement has already begun to be formed. While Lane's strange ideals could prove dangerous to the safety of $COUNTRY$, it is unlikely anything will come of it.

\n\nA group of impoverished Saxon families from Germany, led by Bernhard Förster, have emigrated to $COUNTRY$ in the search of a place to found a utopian settlement in order to practice ideas regarding Aryan supremacy and the like. While these ideas could prove dangerous to our country, they are nothing more than a few colonists, and their development of the land could prove useful.
Answering the "Imperial Question"

The Emperor is the center of an underground, but still significant, debate in Japanese politics. He may not hold the title of absolute ruler anymore, but that does not stop the former rebels of the Sonno Joi movement from still insisting he must overtake the Shogun as Japan's sole monarch. In pre-modern times, the Shogun was supposed to act as commander in chief of the Japanese army, while the Emperor tended to all other affairs. Of course, this has not been the case in several hundred years, ever since the rise of the samurai rulers of old. 

The wave of instability culimating in the Shinsengumi Rebellion has led to the "Imperial Question" being asked again. Is the Emperor really best kept as Speaker of Parliament? Should he be charged with a greater duty? Or, should he be stripped of power to keep this debate from ever coming up again?
A New Status Quo

\n\nAs Speaker of the House of Elders, the Emperor is a significant figure in Japan. He guides the House to vote on matters of state with some independence from the Shogun. However, he too is checked and balanced out by the government branches both above and below him. He cannot call upon policies directly, but he certainly can advocate for them--and, perhaps, form a voting bloc of members who share his personal political beliefs.
The Japanese Dual Monarchy

\n\n"It is not enough anymore for me to stand alone in the highest office of the land," declared the Shogun. "We can only reconcile with those who do not believe I have the right to rule by giving up some of that power to our Emperor. We are not enemies--not anymore." The Shogun addressed Japan in a speech where he declared the Emperor his co-head of state. As was standard hundreds of years ago, the Emperor will now be tasked with domestic matters, addressing the concerns of the Japanese people, while the Shogun prioritizes military and diplomatic affairs. Japan has reinvented itself yet again--or, rather, revived its former self.
Emperor Returned to Ceremonial Role

\n\nDrastic measures have been taken. Seeking to squash the source of unrest in Japan once and for all, the Shogun has privately ordered the Emperor to step down from power, returning again to a ceremonial role. The Emperor departed for the old Imperial Palace in Kyoto inconspicuously, in civilian's clothes to avoid being recognized, then issued a statement confirming he has relinquished power. He has said in this statement that he believes that stepping down is necessary to prevent another civil war. The following day, the Shogun himself stood to address the House of Elders and declared himself head both of the executive branch and legislature. There remains to be seen what comes of this new development in Japanese history.
The New Imperialists

\n\nGradual build-up of the Japanese military now leads our people to wonder: if we are not making war, why do we arm ourselves? Hawkish members of the Council of Elders have begun pushing for a new policy of "Seifukuron," or "Doctrine of Conquest." They say that if the samurai have no one to fight, they will become disloyal to the government. This echoes the ambitions of the daimyo Toyotomi Hideyoshi, who in the late Sengoku period unsuccessfully led a campaign to conquer Korea and China. He did so to distract the samurai from his terminal illness and lack of a legitimate heir. Can Japan today follow in Toyotomi's footsteps?
Prague Uprising of 1848
Prague Uprising of 1848

\n\nFollowing the Hungarian Revolution, a similar but smaller uprising already began brewing in Prague. Only 3 days ago, Prague students met in Karolinum and sent a request to general Windisch-Grätz, demanding that the army, which was monitoring the situation from its deployment around the city, withdraw. After being denied their demands, the students spread the contents of their letter as a leaflet around Prague, stirring up the populace. The uprising has begun in earnest today, with peasants building barricades and fiercely opposing government troops. Our forces had no choice but to retreat and Prague is now controlled by the rebels. The rabble now demand that we grant the Czechs greater autonomy. While this would pacify them, it would also lead to even greater discontent in other Slavic areas. §RWe must act quickly should we decide to quell the rebellion to prevent its spread to other Czech provinces!§!

\n\nToday Muslim residents of Aleppo, largely from the eastern quarters of the city, rioted against Christian residents, mostly  located in the northern suburbs of Judayde and Salibeh. Aleppian residents originally protested against the threat of conscription, and marched to the palace of Mustafa Zarif Pasha, the governor of Aleppo. The rioters then advanced to the predominantly Christian quarters, where they began to loot and pillage both churches and private homes, killing anyone found inside. Do we intervene on behalf of the Christians or let the events run their course?

\n\nThe indigenous ethnic group of the Chatham Islands, the Moriori, are being enslaved and massacred by members of the mainland New Zealand iwi tribes, Ngati Mutunga and Ngati Tama. We have to do something to stop with the massacres and enslavement of the Moriori people in the Chatham Islands.

\n\nToday, a mob attacked a group of sailors on shore leave from the cruiser USS Baltimore outside a bar in the Chilean port of Valparaíso after one of the American sailors spat on a picture of Arturo Prat, one of Chile's national heroes. Two sailors were killed and eighteen were injured. The Chilean government must pay for the victims and structural damage or face the consequences.
Sultan Abdülaziz's Journey to Europe

Ottoman sultans have never traveled to Eastern or Western countries except for campaigns, and only a few have traveled around the empire. Moreover, it is exceptional for Ottoman sultans to go on pilgrimage. Our Sultan, Abdülaziz, has never been in foreign lands. However, due to recent events, our Sultan has decided to break the Darül- Harp (Abode of War), and travel to Europe for diplomatic reasons. The journey has been thoroughly discussed in the palace, and finally a solution has been found. Special compartments built under sultans shoes will be filled with earth so that Sultan Abdülaziz would not step on foreign lands in the countries he visited.
The First Aliyah

\n\nFollowing through with the Zionist idea of resettling the land originally part of the Kingdom of Israel, Jewish immigrants have come to Palestine to seek a new life. They are making what is called in Hebrew "aliyah," or the return of Jews to their ancestral homeland. The Zionist movement's representatives have petitioned $COUNTRY$ to officially agree to permitting the free migration of Jews to Palestine to achieve this goal. Jewish immigrants already have moved to Palestine throughout the early 19th century and even before for religious reasons and to escape persecution, but this is the first time they have come as part of a political, nationalist movement. These new immigrants come in small numbers now due to Zionism being relatively unknown, but it's doubtless that they will soon arrive by the thousands and more.
The First Zionist Congress

\n\nIn $YEAR$, pioneer Zionist Theodor Herzl convened with his followers to finalize the agenda of the Zionist movement. The assembly was officially named the First Zionist National Congress. Having originally planned the event in Munich, Germany, it was moved to Basel due to fierce opposition from the local Reform and Orthodox Jewish populations, who believe the Biblical return to the Promised Land can only be led by God. Nevertheless, the Congress was held, and Zionist leaders agreed to fully pursue the establishment of a Jewish state in Palestine.
The Rise of Palestinian Nationalism

\n\nMass migration of Jews into $COUNTRY$ is becoming a source of resentment for the region's Arab population. The Arabs have begun to vocally oppose the Zionist project, becoming increasingly fearful of their complete marginalization in the land they've called their home for hundreds and hundreds of years. Zionist leaders, meanwhile, have taken a firm stance against any attacks on the local Jews and have adamently rejected prospects of regulating Jewish immigration to protect Arab residents, who find themselves evicted to make way for Jewish settlers. Zionist leaders' main concern clearly is settling as many Jews as possible, which they believe should not require the consent of Arab political leaders.

In $YEAR$, pioneer Zionist Theodor Herzl convened with his followers to finalize the agenda of the Zionist movement. The assembly was officially named the First Zionist National Congress. Having originally planned the event in Munich, Germany, it was moved to Basel due to fierce opposition from the local Reform and Orthodox Jewish populations, who believe the Biblical return to the Promised Land can only be led by God. Nevertheless, the Congress was held, and Zionist leaders agreed to fully pursue the establishment of a Jewish state in Palestine.
The Rise of Palestinian Arab Nationalism

Mass migration of Jews into $COUNTRY$ is becoming a source of resentment for the region's Arab population. The Arabs have begun to vocally oppose the Zionist project, becoming increasingly fearful of their complete marginalization in the land they've called their home for hundreds and hundreds of years. Zionist leaders, meanwhile, have taken a firm stance against any attacks on the local Jews and have adamantly rejected prospects of regulating Jewish immigration to protect Arab residents, who find themselves evicted to make way for Jewish settlers. Zionist leaders' main concern clearly is settling as many Jews as possible, which they believe should not require the consent of Arab political leaders.
The Nebi Musa Riots

\n\nArab militancy in $COUNTRY$ has reached a boiling point, resulting in perhaps the largest incident of inter-communal violence between them and the Jews since the Balfour Declaration. On the Easter Sunday festival of Nebi Musa, between 60,000 and 70,000 Arabs gathered in the Old City of Jerusalem to protest Palestine's colonial rule and facilitation of Jewish immigration to the land. Crowd members chanted antisemitic slogans and soon attacked Jewish residents. The colonial gendarmerie forcibly broke up the riot and instated a curfew, but failed to adequately protect Jews from rioters. Members of the Jewish paramilitary group Irgun, led by Ze'ev Jabotinsky, requested to reinforce colonial troops, but the offer was declined. Consequently, Irgun troops tried to intervene on their own but found themselves unable to pass through the Old City's walls. More pogroms are doubtlessly on the horizon.
The Establishment of the Kibbutzim

\n\nRecent Jewish migrants are increasingly publicly showing support for socialist and communist causes. In hopes of establishing a socialist state in the Land of Israel, many have begun constructing communes known as kibbutzim. Residents of a kibbutz share all resources and are assigned work according to the needs of the community as a whole. If the Jewish homeland is destined to be a socialist nation, guaranteeing the livelihood of all based on shared wealth, who are we to oppose it?
The $YEAR$ Riots

With a generation of Jewish settlement having passed, the Arabs of $COUNTRY$ have reached a point of unrest that has resulted in the bloodiest violence since the start of the Zionist project. Conflict between Jewish and Muslim groups over access to the Temple Mount, a site holy both to Judaism and Islam, occurred earlier this month. However, the main spark of violence occurred when a Jew was stabbed to death by an Arab in the Jerusalem neighborhood of Mea Shearim. Gunfire soon broke out at the Temple Mount as Arabs descended on Jews in the Old City to massacre them. Waves of similar attacks raged on in all major cities. The Jews in turn retaliated through random acts of violence and property damage, following the principle of eye-for-an-eye. 

This is the point of no return.

\n\nBefore the French Revolution a movement of radical-democratic republicans was active who wanted to dethrone King Leopold I, some by force. When the Revolution in France started, they mobilized and set up to do the same here. With the cooperation of the new republican government in Paris, thousands of Belgian guest workers were gathered and taken to Belgium on three trains. The intent was to arm them before the border and create a trail of revolution by associating themselves with local agitators and masses in the towns they passed. Thanks to infiltrated groups, we were informed of the preparations for it. The armament in France was partly prevented and one of the trains was defused. After a fierce firefight, the arrival of artillery was decisive and the republicans were dispersed at Risquons-Tout. Meanwhile, from Bruges to Virton, local riots and revolts were suppressed.

\n\nThe Naturalist on the River Amazons is a newly published book by the British naturalist Henry Walter Bates about his expedition to the Amazon basin. Bates and his friend Alfred Russel Wallace set out to obtain new species and new evidence for evolution by natural selection, as well as exotic specimens to sell. He explored thousands of miles of the Amazon and its tributaries, and collected over 14,000 species, of which 8,000 were new to science. Bates remarks that finding a new species is only the start, he also describes animal behavior, sometimes in detail, as for the army ants. He constantly relates the wildlife to the people, explaining how the people hunt, what they eat and what they use as medicines. The book is illustrated with drawings by leading artists including E. W. Robinson, Josiah Wood Whymper, Joseph Wolf and Johann Baptist Zwecker.

\n\nA derailment occurred today at 16:00, when the GranvilleParis Express overran the buffer stop at its Gare Montparnasse terminus. With the train several minutes late and the driver trying to make up for lost time, it approached the station too fast and the driver's application of the train air brake was ineffective. After running through the buffer stop, the train crossed the station concourse and crashed through the station wall. The locomotive has fallen onto the Place de Rennes below, where it stood on its nose. Although the passengers survived, a woman on the street below has been killed by falling masonry.

\n\nA train wreck occurred today in Whitemarsh Township, Pennsylvania, between Camp Hill station and Fort Washington station. Two trains, traveling on the same track in converging directions, collided, killing between 59 and 67, and injuring over 100. The incident is now referred to as The Camp Hill Disaster in Montgomery County, and The Picnic Train Tragedy in Philadelphia. It's now the deadliest railroad catastrophe to date.

\n\nDiscontent has built up over the years and unrest was to expected. The revolution of February 1848 in Paris has caused a wave of revolutions throughout the Europe which pose a threat to the Luxemburg monarchy. The protest began in form of petitions to authorities. Their extent was unusual, to the effect that 70 petitions were sent in March alone, which had been drafted and signed spontaneously. These petitions originated from towns across the country, indicative of the widespread discontent. Now, a popular uprising has begun with its center in Ettelbruck in the North of the country. Today, angry citizens declared a republic and sang the Marseillaise in spirit of the French revolution. A crowd gathered and blocked the way for the gendarmes when they appeared on the scene, trying to provoke them to use their firearms. Fearing expansion of the revolt, we have sent new forces to Ettelbruck, as a fair will take place there tomorrow. A revolution has begun: let's hope that it fails.
The $YEAR$ Luxembourg Constitution

After a deadly Revolution, we have been forced to write a new constitution. It has been written in a very liberal spirit. It establishes a balance of legislative and executive powers in that it conferres an important place on the Chamber of Deputies as a legislative body and as a body of control of the executive power. In addition, it proclaimes fundamental rights and freedoms, such as equality before the law, freedom of opinion and freedom of the press. With the demands of the Revolution fulfilled, our country can be in peace.
The $YEAR$ Luxembourg Coup

In a speech from the throne, the Governor of Luxembourg, Prince Henry, announced the amendment of the constitution, which he claimed was required to bring it into line with the rest of the German Confederation. Our constitution is too liberal, and it has to be reverted. The liberals in the Chamber are outraged, and demand that any changes respect the freedoms won in the Revolutions of 1848 and the independence of Luxembourg from the Netherlands, which was in a personal union with Luxembourg. We could ignore the liberals' opinion, which don't have much power in the chamber, and revert it anyway. That could provoke a new Revolution though.

\n\nA coaldust explosion, the cause of which is not known with certainty, has devastated a coal mine operated by the Compagnie des mines de houille de Courrières today, causing the death of 1,099 miners in Northern France. A large explosion was heard shortly after 6:30 AM. An elevator cage at Shaft 3 was thrown to the surface, damaging the pit-head: windows and roofs were blown out on the surface at Shaft 4: an elevator cage raised at Shaft 2 contained only dead or unconscious miners. Rescue attempts have begun quickly, but are hampered by the lack of trained mine rescuers in France, and by the scale of the disaster: some two-thirds of the miners in the mine at the time of the explosion have perished, while many survivors suffer from the effects of gas inhalation. This disaster is the worst mining accident to date.

\n\nToday Poles around Tarnów have revolted against serfdom, directed against manorial property and oppression. The recent poor harvests resulted in significant unrest among the local peasantry. The crownland (province) of Galicia is the largest, most populous and poorest province in the Austrian Empire, and is disparagingly known in Vienna as Halbasien (Half-Asia), a province the Austrian officials regarded dismissively as "a barbaric place inhabited by strange people of questionable personal hygiene". Even Poles refer to the zone jokingly as Golicja and Glodomeria (Naked and Hungry). With the recent Kraków uprising, the peasants' rebellion has been ignited.
\n\nAfter not stopping the Galician slaughter, our aristocrats in the area rebelled against our rule. We have to rally an army to stop this at this instance.
The Seven and a Half Days Revolt
The Seven and a Half Days Revolt

\n\nYears ago there was a violent anti-government demonstration which took place at the end of the Third Italian War of Independence. It was organized by disappointed former partisans (who had joined the 'Thousand' after their landing and those who had followed Giuseppe Garibaldi in Aspromonte in 1862). Today the growing misery of the population, cholera and its 3,977 victims in the city and district have taken the final blow to the Palermitan: Thousands of people rose up, many armed, from neighboring villages. Nearly 4,000 rebels attacked the prefecture and police headquarters, killing the inspector general of the Public Security Guard Corps. The city is now in their hands.

King Umberto I today had an attempt made on his life as he was accompanied by his wife, son, and the statesman Benedetto Cairoli. While riding in an open carriage through the procession of a Naples parade, he was attacked by the knife-brandishing anarchist Giovanni Passonante, who yelled as he assailed the King: "Long live Orsini! Long live the universal republic!" Umberto was able to fend off Passonante until an officer of the royal Curassiers Regiment subdued him. Cairoli, meanwhile, was wounded in the thigh as he attempted to shield Umberto. 

This attack is the culmination of the left's seething opposition toward Umberto, who loathe him for his social conservatism. As expected, protest marches both supporting and opposing the attacker have broken out nationwide. It is crucial at this point, shortly after its birth, that the monarchy be protected from the growing political blocs who wish to see it die in its crib.

Another assassination attempt against Umberto I was made today again by an anarchist terrorist. His attacker, Pietro Acciarito, waited amongst a crowd within the Campanelle Hippodrome racecourse in Rome, then charged at the King's carriage with a knife upon its arrival. Umberto was able to dodge the attack, his swiftness having been honed from his familiarity with assassins. Acciarito was sentenced to life in prison. 

The court adjudicating Acciarito's trial attempted to find proof of a larger anti-monarchist conspiracy he was part of. However, Acciarito denied this, insisting he acted alone. The Italian police nevertheless has rounded up anarchist and socialist elements on suspicion of collaboration. None of these arrests have turned up evidence proving Acciarito was not a lone actor. Acciarito's actions have provided a spark for anti-monarchist demonstrations again to break out.

Queen Isabella today narrowly survived an attempt on her life by a rogue priest. While she was attending a mass of thanks for the safe delivery of her child, the priest and liberal agitator Martín Merino y Gómez waited for her as if intending to deliver her a message, then tried to stab her to death. The knife, thankfully, caught on the stays of Isabella's dress, saving her from a fatal wound. Merino was arrested on the spot and imprisoned to be executed later. Our liberal and anti-monarchist populations have clearly grown out of control.

Queen Isabella is ready for marriage, and Britain and France have taken opposite sides on whom to support as her potential husband. Ever since the War of Spanish succession a century ago, France has desired to unite her crown with the Spanish one under the Bourbon dynasty. As such, they support marrying her off to Francis, Duke of Cádiz, her second cousin. However, the British object based on the 1713 Peace of Utrecht, which prohibits the French from appointing a candidate to the Spanish throne. Britain instead supports her marriage to Leopold of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha, a member of the current British royal house. Whomever is chosen will bring Spain closer to the country promoting either candidate. The decision is best left to the discretion of our government. 

What, you thought Isabella had a say in this?

\n\nPeasants and day laborers' discontent is being channeled into a revolt in the municipalities of Sevilla province. Growing social inequality has led to demands for lower costs of living as well as more radical demands such as the abolition of the monarchy. The laborers have burned down estates, chanting "Death to the rich," and attacked the Civil Guard in El Arahal and Utrera, leading to open warfare. Eventually, however, Spanish troops surrounded them as they engaged them in Serranía de Ronda and captured their military leaders, executing them by firing squad.

\n\nThe Cape Town Railway & Dock 0-4-2 has begun operation today. It is the first railway system in South Africa supporting tender locomotives. A modest stretch of track, it is only able as of now to transport cargo and passengers a total of 1 and a half miles between Cape Town Station and Salt River. But for the railway to become open to the public now means that South Africa's rail system is destined only to grow further.

\n\nGreek entrepreneur Nestor Gianaclis has begun a foray into the tobacco industry by founding a factory in Alexandria. Using imported tobacco from Turkey, his ambitious business project seeks to get exploit the high demand for cigarettes and introduce Western tastebuds to an Egyptian-style smoke. Gianaclis' business has the potential to attract fellow Greek tobacco merchants to Alexandria and, in turn, give our economy some much-needed diversity.

\n\nDespite faring somewhat better in Eastern Muslim lands compared to Europe, the Jews of the Orient are still vulnerable to persecution. One example unfolded just recently. After Italian monk Tomaso de Camangiano and his Muslim boy servant went missing in Damascus's Jewish quarter, local gentiles assumed the Jews kidnapped them and murdered them to use their blood in matzo bread. This notorious lie, nicknamed the 'blood libel' and commonly used since the Middle Ages, led the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to investigate. The investigation indeed resulted in bones being found in the sewers below the Jewish quarters, but no forensic analysis was done to confirm whose they were. Jews were then rounded up and interrogated, with one prisoner confessing under torture to the murders along with seven other men. The aftermath has seen Christians and Muslims terrorizing the Jewish quarter: synagogues destroyed, shops vandalized, people beaten in the streets. Jews the world over, meanwhile, united by their conviction to end their people's suffering, have rallied to condemn the persecution.
The Basuto Gun War
The Basuto Gun War

\n\nJapan's economy is not quite geared yet to creating a global demand for our goods and services. Yet with times constantly changing and businesses growing increasingly ambitious to attain untold riches, the economy may well yet reshape itself to compete with the largest of trade powers. Ready to take up this mantle are the zaibatsu: family-owned conglomerations holding a wide variety of companies. Their holding companies are in turn funded by investment banks, allowing the zaibatsu to easily create monopolies if they grow large enough. The Japanese government may easily take advantage of the zaibatsu to carry out tasks more efficiently than national institutions can, such as tax collection, supplying the military, and guiding foreign trade. The question is: should we? Will the zaibatsu be at the center of Japan's economic future?

\n\nA massive pogrom occurred in Mashhad today at the behest of the city's leader. Upon his orders, Muslim residents have attacked local Jews, burned down their synagogue, looted their homes, and abducted girls and women. This violence was motivated by a desire to rid the population of non-Muslims: many Jews were pressured into renouncing their religion and publicly converting to Islam, appearing in public as openly Muslim but continuing to practice Judaism secretly at home. Others fled the city for nearby Herat. The brutality has been warmly received by Persia's Muslims, with the event being dubbed "Allahdad"--or "God's Justice."

\n\nOur nation has occupied and annexed the Golan Heights, or "Ramat Hagolan" in Hebrew. This land was once part of the tribe of Menasseh, with the ancient city of Golan being one of the six Levitical cities of refuge. It was an inseparable part of the Israelite domain, and it should be treated as part and parcel of our modern nation.

\n\nAustralian pearls were first gathered by Aboriginals, soon attracting the interest of colonists. Now, in $PROVINCENAME$, they have begun a full pearling industry using Aboriginals as forced labor. Their job is perilous and many die of shark attacks, storms, disease, maltreatment and the bends. Still, the pearling business is immensely profitable: A virtual gold rush has begun, with colonists from all over swarming to $PROVINCENAME$ to get in on the pearl business.

In the wake of riots in nearby Jerusalem, the previously peacefully coexisting Arab and Jewish people of Hebron have had their relations irreparably damaged. Hebron, a Jewish and Muslim holy city known for housing the Cave of the Patriarchs, became the site of a pogrom. False rumors about Jews carrying out the "wholesale killing of Arabs" were spread, leading Arab rioters to attack Jews on the streets, in synagogues, and at the town's yeshiva. 

Ashkenazi Jews were particularly targeted because of them being perceived as foreign colonizers, unlike the local Sephardic Jews, who are well assimilated and speak Arabic. In total, 12 Sfaradim and 55 Ashkenazim were killed.

\n\nThe Jews of $FROM$, beleaguered by a hostile Arab population that will not let up on attacking them to prevent the founding of the Jewish state, are now demanding independence. They threaten to fight a war of liberation if we refuse. However, it would be a betrayal of our charter for the Zionists if we denied them independence, considering how we helped them settle in the region and establish political autonomy.
$FROM$ Grants Us our Freedom!
\n\nThe Jewish homeland, after 2,000 years of continuous foreign rule, is finally independent!
Our Independence Has Not Been Granted
\n\n$FROM$ refused our demand for independence--an absolute disgrace.

\n\nArab militancy in $COUNTRY$ has reached a boiling point, resulting in perhaps the largest incident of inter-communal violence between them and the Jews since the Balfour Declaration. On the Easter Sunday festival of Nebi Musa, between 60,000 and 70,000 Arabs gathered in the Old City of Jerusalem to protest Jewish immigration to the land. Crowd members chanted antisemitic slogans and soon started attacking Jewish residents. The gendarmerie forcibly broke up the riot and instated a curfew, but failed to adequately protect Jews from rioters. Members of the Jewish paramilitary group Irgun, led by Ze'ev Jabotinsky, tried to intervene on their own but found themselves unable to pass through the Old City's walls. More pogroms are doubtlessly on the horizon.

The unorganized resistance to the Zionist project has officially broken out into a military conflict. With outrage in the Arab world over the relinquishment of land by the Palestinian Arabs to Jewish settlers, all hope of a shared sovereignty between Jews and Arabs in the land of Israel has been lost. Gunfire broke out as Arabs ambushed a bus carrying Jewish immigrants. As Jewish forces attempted to mobilize and prevent further attacks, the Arabs' intentions were made clear: they plan a full overthrow of Jewish sovereignty, seeing it as a settler colonial project intended to erase the Arab presence in the land. If they succeed, they will surely attempt to expel and massacre our land's Jewish inhabitants, as they have already recently.

Come what may of their endeavor, we are prepared to show that, as people with ancient roots here, our ancestral right to sovereignty in Eretz Yisrael will not be taken from us!

\n\nOver the years, a modest Jewish neighborhood built on the outskirts of Jaffa has grown into a city in its own right, attracting thousands of immigrants to settle within. Originally named Ahuzat Bayit, the town was been renamed Tel Aviv, after the Hebrew name of Theodor Herzl's seminal Zionist work Altneuland . With Jewish immigrants flocking to a city whose mayor, Akiva Arieh Weiss, intends to give all the virtues of modern Western civilization, Tel Aviv has become a metropolitan counterpart to the ancient port city of Jaffa and has overtaken its population. Tel Aviv today is the pinnacle of Klal Yisrael's national revival: a cultural capital of the Jewish people.

The defeat of the Palestinian insurgency has left local Arabs in a panic over their livelihood. By the scores, they have fleeing their homes in panic as the Haganah and other Zionist paramilitaries launched assaults on their villages, or out of anticipation of attacks. Some have even been expelled for the military's expedience, such as in the towns of Lod and Ramle. The events of this Palestinian mass flight will inevitably be a source of indelible tension between the Jews and Arabs throughout the region, since the depopulated villages the Arabs have left behind will doubtlessly be resettled by Jews, and the Arabs will most likely not be allowed to return so as to ensure a Jewish majority and prevent a fifth column from continuing to exist in the Jewish State. Their flight will erase most of the visible presence of Arabs in the Land of Israel.

We fought for our freedom and won, but at what cost?
$FROM$ refused our demand for independence--an absolute disgrace.

Arab militancy in $COUNTRY$ has reached a boiling point, resulting in perhaps the largest incident of inter-communal violence between them and the Jews since the Balfour Declaration. On the Easter Sunday festival of Nebi Musa, between 60,000 and 70,000 Arabs gathered in the Old City of Jerusalem to protest Jewish immigration to the land. Crowd members chanted antisemitic slogans and soon started attacking Jewish residents. The gendarmerie forcibly broke up the riot and instated a curfew, but failed to adequately protect Jews from rioters. Members of the Jewish paramilitary group Irgun, led by Ze'ev Jabotinsky, tried to intervene on their own but found themselves unable to pass through the Old City's walls. More pogroms are doubtlessly on the horizon.

The unorganized resistance to the Zionist project has officially broken out into a military conflict. With outrage in the Arab world over the relinquishment of land by the Palestinian Arabs to Jewish settlers, all hope of a shared sovereignty between Jews and Arabs in the land of Israel has been lost. Gunfire broke out as Arabs ambushed a bus carrying Jewish immigrants. As Jewish forces attempted to mobilize and prevent further attacks, the Arabs' intentions were made clear: they plan a full overthrow of Jewish sovereignty, seeing it as a settler colonial project intended to erase the Arab presence in the land. If they succeed, they will surely attempt to expel and massacre our land's Jewish inhabitants, as they have already recently.\n\nCome what may of their endeavor, we are prepared to show that, as people with ancient roots here, our ancestral right to sovereignty in Eretz Yisrael will not be taken from us!

Over the years, a modest Jewish neighborhood built on the outskirts of Jaffa has grown into a city in its own right, attracting thousands of immigrants to settle within. Originally named Ahuzat Bayit, the town was been renamed Tel Aviv, after the Hebrew name of Theodor Herzl's seminal Zionist work Altneuland . With Jewish immigrants flocking to a city whose mayor, Akiva Arieh Weiss, intends to give all the virtues of modern Western civilization, Tel Aviv has become a metropolitan counterpart to the ancient port city of Jaffa and has overtaken its population. Tel Aviv today is the pinnacle of Am Yisrael's national revival: a cultural capital of the Jewish people.

The defeat of the Palestinian insurgency has left local Arabs in a panic over their livelihood. By the scores, they have fleeing their homes in panic as the Haganah and other Zionist paramilitaries launched assaults on their villages, or out of anticipation of attacks. Some have even been expelled for the military's expedience, such as in the towns of Lod and Ramle. The depopulated villages the Arabs have left behind will doubtlessly be resettled by Jews, and the Arabs will most likely not be allowed to return so as to ensure a Jewish majority and prevent a fifth column from continuing to exist in the Jewish State. Their flight will erase most of the visible presence of Arabs in the Land of Israel.\n\nWe fought for our freedom and won, but at what cost?

Under heavy Zionist lobbying, our overlord has declared that a future Jewish state shall be created within our borders. However, since we still have control over the expropriation of our own territory, it rests on us to officially say the words when this Jewish state will be established.

"We herewith proclaim the independence of Korea and the liberty of the Korean people. This we proclaim to all the nations of the world in witness of human equality. This we proclaim to our descendants so that they may enjoy in perpetuity their inherent right to nationhood."

Since March 1st, approximately 2 million Koreans have participated in 1,500 individual protests against Japanese rule. The movement came as a long-coming powder keg of civil rest in Korea, a nation with an ancient history that has been totally subsumed by Japan. Despite their resolve to see their liberation through, the demonstrations were largely peaceful until the Japanese police lost the ability to control the crowds and sent in the military. The result has been massacres of Korean protesters by the thousands. Nevertheless, Koreans remain undeterred, ready to continue organizing.

\n\nA light rain complements a lively rally in Chicago's Haymarket Square for eight-hour work days. To an estimated 600 to 3,000 disgruntled workers, the progressive leaders August Spies, Albert Parsons, and Rev. Samuel Fielden give igniting speeches enumerating the grievances of workers who toil for long hours for paltry pay, barely enough to feed themselves or their families. After Fielden's 20 minute speech, however, police begin to amass around the rally and call for it to disperse, moving in to forcibly clear the premises. Suddenly, a homemade bomb is thrown at the police, killing seven officers. Pandemonium ensues: a flurry of gunfire is exchanged between police and protesters, and officers even fire upon fleeing unarmed civilians. The media has concluded that the workers threw the bomb, while progressive activists state it was a police mole who threw it.

\n\nIn recent times, a fair amount of Swiss immigrants have been arriving on $COUNTRY_ADJ$ lands to seek a better life. While most have settled in the large cities and areas of growing population density, some families seek to work the fields in Santa Fe instead, with some remarkable foundations regarding a colony named Helvecia. Provided we sell them a lease of land in the near-barren areas of the province, they could help develop the region.

\n\nJewish refugees from Kamianets-Podilski fleeing persecution are seeking to immigrate to $COUNTRY$. Initially thinking to settle an area of inner Buenos Aires province, the price of the land has risen and has made it impossible for them to purchase the properties in the area. Some aristocrats have offered an area of land around Santa Fe to the settlers, but this land has not met their expectations. They are currently living in deplorable conditions. Their plight has come to the attention of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs--we could help the colonists thrive with some economic aid, although it would be expensive.

\n\nFollowing the boom around the southern coast of Mar Chiquita, there have been talks of encouraging the small but growing fishing industry around the Miramar area. Although it could be beneficial, this also could end catastrophically and plunge the region into poverty if not handled correctly. Instead, a safer choice could be made: funding the Quebracho tree lumber industry on the lake's islands and coast.

\n\nThe plan to develop the Mesopotamia into the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ heartland was a success, but there is still more to be done. The regions adjacent to the Paraná river are not as developed as their immediate neighbors, creating a difficult contrast. There are proposals in $CAPITAL$ to extend the development plan to nearby regions. These could, however, be quite pricey.
Agricultural Colonies

With the Palestinian Arab insurgency defeated, the Arabs of Eretz Yisrael have been left deathly afraid of their future in their homeland of over a millennium. To secure the right for Jews to continue settling the land, and to prevent a fifth column from forever being present in Israel's borders, the Haganah's high command all expected an order to come to expel the Arabs or encourage them to leave. Such a command, however, never came to reality. The Arabs of the villages most affected by the conflict have not fled in panic, but have chosen determinedly to stay.

Zionist leaders have instead put their energy into building trust with Arab leaders. Haganah forces oversee the reconstruction of Jewish and Arab communities alike. Jewish towns' mayors negotiate with Arab mukhtars about resources and the state's future budget for both communities. There is still general distrust between Jews and Arabs due to their opposing aspirations for self-determination in the same land. However, steps toward reconciliation are rapidly being made.

Rural farmers, typically of poor background, are increasingly getting involved in Norwegian politics. This phenomenon is thanks to the rise of leaders representing the country's common people, such as Ole Gabriel Ueland and Søren Pedersen Jaabæk. Ueland started his political career as a farmer with no formal education, eventually coming to represent the district of Stavanger Amt in the Storting. He is respected for his advocacy for farmers' welfare. Jaabæk, in addition to now representing Lister og Magdals Amt in the Storting, has founded the Bondevennerne, a political advocacy group for peasants named after a similar organization in Denmark.

Norway is entering a new age of social progress. May the country and its people thrive!
Indians Demand Our Withdrawal

\n\nOur control of India is in peril: native forces now occupy Bombay, Calcutta, Delhi, Jubulpore, and Patna--the Raj's foremost administrative centers. Our subcontinental adversary, therefore, has enough leverage to demand an end to our rule over India. It might be worth it to comply, lest we prolong this war and further embarrass ourselves globally.

\n\nEthnic Koreans have migrated to Manchuria in large numbers since the start of the 19th century, becoming a dominant ethnic group especially within the south of the region. Within recent years, however, Koreans have begun infiltrating into Manchuria in larger numbers than ever before to escape famine in our country's north, mainly Yanbian province and its surroundings. Yanbian province specifically is part a once disputed territory called Jiandao, claimed by us until 1712, when a treaty with the Qing demarcated our borders along the Tumen River. The number of Koreans in Jiandao has led to an interesting development: they claim that their demographics alone ought to make the land Korean soil. China intends to deport these migrants, and we must step in to protect them. Perhaps this means we ought to reassert a claim to Jiandao--or Gando in Korean.

\n\nEthnic Koreans have migrated to Manchuria in large numbers since the start of the 19th century, becoming a dominant ethnic group especially within the south of the region. Within recent years, however, Koreans have begun infiltrating into Manchuria in larger numbers than ever before to escape famine in the country's north, mainly Yanbian province and its surroundings. Yanbian province specifically is part a once disputed territory called Jiandao, claimed by Korea until 1712, when we signed a treaty with them demarcating our borders along the Tumen River. The number of Koreans in Jiandao has led to an interesting development: they claim that their demographics alone ought to make the land Korean soil. In turn, Korea has asserted a claim to sovereignty over Jiandao--or Gando in their language. This surely would be cause for war if Korea intends to back up their claim with military force.
\n\nWith Germany at last united under Habsburg rule, we have the opportunity to choose a grand and glorious capital.
Frankfurt, the seat of the old German Confederation.
Aachen, the beautiful and historical capital of Charlemagne.
Leipzig, a symbol of German unity and the site of the Battle of the Nations..
Berlin, an intellectual powerhouse, and the former capital of Prussia.
Vienna, our current capital and the power base of the our great dynasty.

\n\nAfter our victory in the Austro-Prussian war, several Great Powers were alarmed after our severe peace deal against the Prussians and started to make plans to organize a coalition against us, however, the British decided to solve this problem by organizing a meeting in London which several European Powers attended. After much debate over the fate of Germany and Central Europe, it was agreed to force us into a compromise that would demand several concessions in Central and Eastern Europe, including the loss of all non-German territories in exchange for our complete control over Germany. Namely, Western European powers demanded the creation of a large independent Hungary, while Galicia-Londomeria would be handed over to the Russians as an autonomous region, and predominantly Italian territories would be ceded to Italy. The only loser in the conference was France, whom the Great Powers denied any chance to annex territory on the left bank of the Rhine, land which France has either once controlled or aspired to control since Napoleon's reign.

\n\nAfter the Prussian defeat and the expulsion of the Prussians from Berlin, several Great Powers reunited in London to discuss about the fate of Germany and Central Europe. At the end it was agreed that Austria must give up its ethnically non-German lands and suffer several concessions from their neighbors. However, our demand for everything on the left bank of the Rhine was outrageously rejected by the other powers, leaving us with no territorial gains whatsoever by the conference's end. But maybe we can organize a lesser concession for the southern part of the left bank of the Rhine, however, it all depend on the Austrian response.
\n\nFrance has demanded concessions in the Rhine's southern east bank as compensation for our victory against Prussia. How should we respond?

\n\nThe north of New Zealand's South Island was hit by a high magnitude earthquake today at 10:17 AM, creating widespread damage. The quake occurred within an epicenter around Nelson, Greymouth, and Westport, at a 12-kilometer focal depth. The surrounding region suffered large enough damages to lay ruin to roads, buildings, and bridges alike, within an estimated 26,000 square kilometers. 14 of the 17 resulting deaths resulted from landslides, while the other two souls perished in a coal mine collapse. Locals also report that the quake created a new water fall 8 kilometers southwest of Murchison, at the end of the Maruia River.

The earth continues to shake unpenitently and drag the people of New Zealand into the ground, burying them alive. At 10:47 AM, in the eastern North Island, a 7.8 magnitude earthquake struck that killed 256 and injured thousands. The Hawke's Bay region was utterly destroyed, thousands of its people suddenly thrust into homelessness.

The quake has been called the worst natural disaster in New Zealand's history. That label certainly does not feel premature--the destruction has even caught the King's attention, who telegraphed the Governor-General a message sharing his condolences.

\n\nThe ascension of the Emperor to the sole Japanese sovereign currently is not taken lightly by China and those under its sphere of influence. Korea, for example, has refused to recognize the use of the word "Tenno" to describe the Emperor, which implies ceremonial superiority to the Korean King and equality with his overlord, the Chinese Emperor. Hawkish nobles have insisted we use this diplomatic row as an opportunity to send a punitive expedition to Korea and flex our military might. It would provide jobs for unemployed samurai and distract them from their dissatisfaction with the new regime. But is a war over such an easily reconciled misunderstanding worth it?

\n\nJapan has voiced total outrage at the result of a diplomatic mission to our country, which resulted in the death of the ambassador Saigo Takamori. Shortly after arrival in Korea, Saigo had been scheduled to meet with several Joseon bureaucrats to discuss relations between our countries. He arrived at this meeting with a katana in hand, then striking at the bureaucrats without provocation in a fit of inexplicable rage. A retainer restrained and then killed Saigo. All Japanese diplomats have resultantly been expelled from our kingdom. Japan, however, refuses to claim responsibility for Saigo's behavior, instead insisting that his treatment under Korean hospitality was "inhumane" and "barbarous." We suspect Saigo's behavior was intentional--that he acted on Japan's orders so they may claim a casus belli. Come what may of this war, we will fight to the last man for our security and sovereignty!

A most unusual piece of "artwork" has appeared at New York City's inaugural exhibition of the Society of Independent Artists. The work, credited to Frenchman Marcel Duchamp, is a dismounted urinal placed on a wooden column, signed on the front with the pseudonymous signature "R. Mutt" and the year 1917. Duchamp presented the work as a "sculpture," whose purpose reflected how everyday objects may be "raised to the dignity of a work of art by the artist's act of choice."

The Society did not reject the work, as Duchamp paid the submission fee. However, they refused to display it at the exhibition. The sculpture's existence would come to light when photographer Alfred Stieglitz captured a photo of it at Manhattan's 291 Art Gallery. The work remains there as a curiosity--forcing the viewer to examine what even constitutes a piece of art.
Hey, Slavs!

\n\nWhile our unification of the Slavic people is in and of itself a truly bombastic achievement, our government now faces a great challenge: Settling on a national anthem. The popular panslavic song "Hey Slavs", composed by Slovak prosaist Samo Tomáik, seems to be an obvious choice, but which definitive version we would use for official ceremonies or parades remains to be decided.
Hej, Slaveni!
Hej, Sloveni!
Hej, Slovani!
Hej, Slovania!
Keep the old anthem.
The Slavic Integration

\n\nThe formation of the Slavic Union speaks volumes of the capacity that our people have to endure struggles. We have united all of our brothers and sisters under one single flag, may the union prevail!.
Welcome brothers!

The formation of the Slavic Union speaks volumes of the capacity that our people have to endure struggles. We have united all of our brothers and sisters under one single flag, may the union prevail!.
Welcome brothers!
Reaffirmation of Papal Supremacy

For nearly three centuries now, the power of the Papacy has been in steady decline. Once the heart of the Catholic world, the Vatican's temporal power has been eroded time and again by the march of materialism and secularism. With the rise of the Papacy to a power on the secular world stage, however, this trend has begun to reverse, and the Catholics of Europe shall recognize once again the Papal prerogative.
God Willing!

Rerum Novarum

Rerum Novarum, 'of Revolutionary Change,' was an encyclical issued by Pope Leo XIII on the 15th of May, 1891. This paper is often considered to be the key founding document of the economic ideology known as distributism, which disavows both unfettered capitalism and totalitarian socialism as proper methods of economics, instead favoring a small-business, agrarian model of economics.
The shephard shall lead, and the sheep shall follow.!
